loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 32-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.She is a teacher and has been in service for two years. Her personal goal is building a permanent house and diversifying into farming by buying land for crop growing.

She also says that being able to teach has always been her dream and her inspiration is to see the young people's enthusiasm in education since she studied under very unfavorable conditions due to poverty at home. Eliza needs the loan facility to buy land for crop growing.

loans.use: to buy land for crop growing.

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.en:
Anacleto is a 39-year-old married man with one child. Anacleto involved himself in raising crops, particularly planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been in the business for 10 years and earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season twice a year. He is now asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000. He will buy 9 bags of rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers to use in farming. He hopes this loan will be given to him as a way of improving his crop production and enabling him to pay his child's education. 
Anacleto hopes to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy 9 bags of rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold believes that "Patience and hard work are the key to overcome poverty." He is 32 years old and still single. His ambition in life is to help his parents support his younger brothers and sisters, and to improve their status of living. He plans to educate his younger bothers and sisters so that they will earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Arnold needs to improve his hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. The loan will help him to work toward his plan of growing his business to help his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George's primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. This way, he earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season twice a year.

George is now 41 years old, married, and has four children attending to school. He would like to improve his farming output but he has inadequate funds to sustain his crops. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. This will help improve good growth of his crops and will increase his income too. 

George would like to keep producing abundant harvests from the farming business in order to pay his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a mother who is married to a farmer and they raise their family in a village. They are gifted with five children and they want them to each earn a degree so that they find good jobs someday. To generate income, they help each other in managing their farm lot by planting corn and vegetables to sell. They aim to increase their yields so they have the income to meet their daily needs and pay for their children's education. Leonor and her husband have plans to expand their planted corn to ensure high production, but they have not been able to do so because they cannot afford it. So, Leonor is requesting an additional P35,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in corn farming. This loan will enable she and her husband to expand their planting. They are hoping to have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business of Bernardo. He lives in his small house at Roma Sur with his wife and four children. His wife helps him manage the farming business. They have been planting and harvesting rice for over 10 years and earn a minimum income of PHP 8,000 per harvest season. 

Now, Bernardo is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for crop maintenance. He hopes to keep growing rice to meet all his children's needs for school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia raises crops in her village at Roma Sur. She is widowed, therefore she carries the burden alone of sending her three children to school. She pays for laborers who help her in sowing, tilling, planting, and harvesting rice. She has been in the farming business for 10 years and earns PHP 12,000 each harvest season twice a year. The money is used for meals, electric bills, and school fees. 

Leticia would like to make her crops produce more so she is now asking for a loan to maintain her farm. She is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs of farming. She hopes to keep making the business profitable and gain enough funds for her family's progress.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor costs of farming

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is a determined father. He is giving the best of his efforts to the rice farming business. He plants and harvests rice to sell. Eugenio's wife is his partner in the business. Income from his business is used for meals and the allowances of his four children. He would like to give them the best education. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides. This will help maintain good growth of his crops. 

Someday, Eugenio hopes for an abundant harvest and to keep boosting up his profits.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Romell

texts.en:
As a father, Romell is responsible for supporting his family and giving them a better life. Therefore, Romell is striving hard to support his family. He is 40 years old and has one school-age child. He aims to improve the family's living condition and to educate his child and give him a bright future. Due to financial difficulty, he engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

He plans to raise more pigs to sell in the future. He is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. He mentioned that the loan would help him to make an improvement in his business and hopes that his business is successful and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Laurelio

texts.en:
Being a farmer, Laurelio aims to have a fruitful harvest and earn a higher income. He aims to improve his vegetable production business to earn a higher income and satisfy his family's needs. He is a father who has two school-age children. He is raising his family in a village while planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. He aims to continue sending his children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. 

He plans to plant more vegetables and raise livestock for sale but due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask for an additional PHP 15,000 to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production. He hopes that his patience and hard work will enable him to improve his farming business and hopes that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Djata

texts.fr:
Agée de 29 ans, Madame Djata est mariée et réside dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et leur fille à Banconi, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso..
Madame Djata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat de noix d’anacarde  afin d’en extraire les pépins et en faire des croquettes après grillade.  Elle a appris avec activité de transformation avec une voisine. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal en compagnie de ses amies. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an. Elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Vu son expérience dans l’activité, Madame Djata vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 3 sacs de noix d’anacarde afin de les transformés pour donner des noix d’anacarde de bonne qualité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aged 29, Mrs Djata is married and lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their daughter in Banconi, one of the working class areas of Sikasso.
Having had many unsuccessful activities Mrs Djata started this business buying cashew nuts and extracting the seeds to make into croquettes after grilling. She learned this transformation  process from a neighbour. She runs her business from her family home with her friends. She is much sought after by her customers due to the quality of her products. To satisfy her growing clientele, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution a year ago. This is her first individual loan.
In view of her experience in the business, Mrs Djata sells her merchandise for cash or credit to her clientele made up of men and women.
With this loan she intends to purchase 3 bags of cashew nuts for processing into good quality cashew nuts.
With this loan She plans to make a monthly profit of 90 000 FCFA which will be used to contribute to family expenses, to pay the interests of her loan and the remainder will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Âgé de 27 ans, Monsieur Mohamed  est un  célibataire qui réside chez son feu père à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Mohamed après l’obtention d’un diplôme en comptabilité et après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente de téléphones portables et accessoires (façade, batteries, chargeurs, écouteurs, etc.) depuis plus de cinq ans. Il mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso où il dispose d’une boutique au bord du goudron sur la route RN7. Monsieur  Mohamed est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année et avec qui il  est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 20 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 2 cartons de façade, 10 chargeurs, 10 paquets de carte mémoire, 5 grosses montres, 5 cartons de carton de batterie et 2 douzaines d’écouteur. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et les revendre à une clientèle composée généralement des jeunes et surtout des forains qui viennent aux foires hebdomadaires tous les Samedi et Dimanche.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Mohamed is a 27-year-old single man who lives in his late father’s house in Medina, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso. Having earned an accounting degree and attempted several income-generating activities without success, he started selling mobile phones and accessories (skin cases, batteries, chargers, headsets, etc.) over five years ago. He conducts his sales at the Grand market of Sikasso where he has a stall near the goudron (a tarmac road) on National Road 7. He is in high demand due to the quality of his merchandise. 

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, Mr. Mohamed joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. This is his first individual loan. He will use this first loan to buy 20 mobile phones of various brands, 2 cartons of skin cases, 10 chargers, 10 packs of memory cards, 5 large watches, 5 cartons of batteries and 2 dozen headsets. He buys his stock in Bamako and sells his goods to the younger crowd as well as fair-goers who come to the weekly fair on Saturdays and Sundays. 

He hopes to earn a monthly profit of 200,000CFAF, which he will use help with the household expenses and to pay the loan interest. Any remainder will be reinvested in his activity.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Rokiatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Rokiatou a 26 ans, elle est mariée et  réside avec son époux et leurs trois  enfants  à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Rokiatou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des  friperies il y a plus de cinq  ans. Elle mène son activité au marché de son quartier et souvent de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quatre  ans. Après 2 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel . 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 2 balles de friperie de qualités différentes 
(respectivement: Tee-Shirt, habits pour d’enfants-, draps et Body). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place avec les grossistes avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Rokiatou is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their 3 children in Wayerma II, one of the popular districts of the town of Sikasso. Rokiatou started selling second hand clothing more than 5 years ago, having tried several other businesses without success. She carries out her business at a local market, and also sells on the streets of Sikasso where she is much in demand thanks to the quality of her products.

In order to satisfy the demands of her growing customer base, Rokiatou decided to join the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso over 4 years ago. She is now on her first individual loan, after 2 group loans requested together with a local woman's association. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bales of second hand clothing (e.g. t-shirts, children's clothing, sheets and lingerie bodies) of mixed quality. She gets her merchandise locally from wholesalers before reselling it retail.

With the loan, Rokiatou expects to make a monthly profit of 75 000 francs, which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, pay off the interest on her loans and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1974 à Sikasso, Monsieur   Issa  est marié  et vit avec son épouse dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier Fama, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Issa n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  s’est vite initié au métier de menuiserie  métallique depuis plus de neuf ans, depuis très jeune. Il travaille actuellement avec trois apprentis dans son propre atelier il y a environ deux années et est beaucoup sollicité  de la plupart de ses clients pour la qualité de ses prestations.
C’est pour mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, qu’il sollicite ce troisième prêt individuel au niveau de Soro Yiriwaso, les deux prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés.
    Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter, 5 barres de fer U, 5 barres de fer Z, 4 paquets de baguettes, 5 feuilles de tôle et 4 rouleaux de fil. Il achète ses matériels dans les quincaillerie de la ville avant de concevoir des produits (des chaises, tables, bancs, etc.) afin de les revendre.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1974 in Sikasso, Issa is married and lives with his wife in a traditional, extended family environment in the district of Fama, one of the outlying districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Issa, unable to continue with his education, quickly started in the profession of metal working at a young age, a job he has been doing for over 9 years. He has been working with 3 apprentices in his own workshop for about 2 years and is sought after by most of his customers because of the quality of his workmanship.

To be able to better respond to the expectations of his customer base, which keeps growing, Issa is requesting this 3rd individual loan from Soro Yiriwaso. The 2 previous loans were correctly repaid. He plans to use this new loan to buy 5 bars of 'U' iron, 5 bars of 'Z' iron, 4 packets of rods, 5 sheets of metal and 4 rolls of wire. He buys his material from the ironmongers in town before creating products (chairs, tables, benches, etc.) for resale.

With this loan, Issa expects to make a monthly profit of 150 000 francs, which will be used to contribute to the family expenditures, to pay off the interest from his loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, rods, 'U' and "Z' iron and rolls of wire.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kator. She sells breads and has been in business for four years. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children; five of them are still in school. 

Hellen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Fredelin

texts.en:
Fredelin is selling candies in the village as a source of income. She has been blessed with three children who are currently studying. With her business, Fredelin is able to provide their daily allowances but suffers with insufficient funds for her business. Consequently, Fredelin is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy candies and pastries to improve her business.

She hopes that through these added goods she will be able to earn more income in order to provide her children with better schooling.

loans.use: to buy candies and pastries to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a 43-year-old tailor in the village. She is married and a mother of two children who are currently studying in college. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the last 12 years with great success. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and more cloth materials to produce more gowns and pants. in connection to this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000.

She anticipates that she will earn higher profits in the business to give better schooling to her children. She also hopes that through her business and hard work, she will have a prosperous life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and more cloth.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona lives in Kator. She sells groundnuts and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. 

Lona heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase groundnuts. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Bandjougou Youssouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Bandjougou Youssouf  est âgé de plus de 34 ans marié et père de quatre enfants. Il est domicilié avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Kamalen Sirakoro commune rurale de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Bandjougou Youssouf après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) il y a maintenant sept  ans. Il dispose de son magasin à Kaboïla I. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant quelques mois et avec qui il est à son premier prêt.
Il compte avec ce premier prêt  acheter 20 sacs de Maïs et 20 sacs de Mil en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’êtres revendues à une clientèle composée des détaillants et des chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Bandjougou Youssouf is over 34 years old, married, and the father of four children.  He lives with his wife and children in a large traditional family in Kamalen Sirakoro, rural commune of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

After being involved in several activities without much success, Bandjougou Youssouf learned how to store and sell grains (maize, millet, sorghum) seven years ago.  He owns a shop in Kaboïla I.

Eager to better meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, he decided a few months ago to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and this is his first loan.

He plans to use this first loan to buy 20 sacks of maize and 20 sacks of millet from localities around Sikasso.  Bandjougou Youssouf first stores his goods in his shop before reselling them to retailers and heads of households.

With this loan, Bandjougou Youssouf is expecting average monthly profits to reach 100,000 CFA francs, which will be essentially used to boost his business and pay off his loan's interest.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita, age 48, buys and sells bananas and vegetables. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy more bananas, onions, and ginger to sell. Benita hopes to improve her business for the sake of her one child.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, onions, and ginger.

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abou a 34 ans, marié et père de deux enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Bougoula Hameau, commune rurale de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Abou après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au commerce d’articles divers dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc) il y a maintenant six  ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant six mois et avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur  Abou vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 3 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 2 cartons du thé, 1 sac du sucre, 5 paquets de bonbons, 10 paquet de Chewing Gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes et 5 cartons de savon. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre en détail.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Abou is a 34-year-old married father of two children. He lives with his family in Bougoula, a rural community of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having attempted several income-generating activities without success, he started trading various merchandise from a stall in front of the family home. He buys and sells a wide variety of goods such as cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc. He is in high demand due to the quality of his merchandise. He sells for cash or credit to a diverse clientele. 

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso six months ago. This is his first individual loan. He will use this first loan to buy three cartons of cigarettes of various brands, two cartons of tea, one bag of sugar, five packs of candy, ten packs of chewing gum, 30 packs of matches, and five cartons of soap. He buys his stock from local wholesalers to resell at retail. 

He hopes to earn a monthly profit of 170,000CFAF, which he will use primarily to bolster his working capital, to help with the household expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en:
Aisa lives in Kator. She sells breads and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. 

Aisa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in future.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Sherley

texts.en:
Sherley is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children who are currently studying.  For the past 5 years, Sherley has been working hard to manage her sari-sari store business.

To help expand her business, Sherley is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, and biscuits. She hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, and biscuits.

loans.name: Lety

texts.en:
Due to hardship of living, Lety and her husband aim to improve their rice farming business to satisfy their necessities and to finance the education of their three children. They live happily in a village, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. They have been farmers for almost 25 years and usually earn a profit of PHP25,000 in every harvest season. They utilize their income for their daily consumption and for the allowances of their children in school. 

They plan to expand their rice plantation to ensure a high production but due to insufficient capital, Lety is asking for an additional PHP30,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice. They believe that this loan will help them to improve their farming business and they are hoping that they will be having a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Aymen

texts.en:
Aymen is 22 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has been working hard to manage his retail shop. He started his business with limited capital that he provided himself to open his business.
 
To help expand his business, he has requested a youth loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to buy canned food, mineral water and other products. The loan will help him to generate greater profits. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy canned food, mineral water and other products to sell

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania  es casada, tiene 7 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “El Buen Samaritano” grupo  conformado por 9   socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Melania  trabaja desde hace  2 años  en su propia bodega  donde vende, abarrotes etc.  ella empezó vendiendo algunos productos tiempo después pudo ampliar su negocio, Nos cuenta que nada fue fácil porque trabajo muy duro junto a su esposo , pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos cuentan  con educación y sobretodo tienen una mejor calidad de vida ,  nos cuenta que como mujer se siente muy orgullosa e independiente. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería (leche,fideos, arroz etc). Sabemos que Melania  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
La sra laura es aquella que se encuentra en la parte superior de la foto con casaca azul.
texts.en:
Melania is married and has 7 children. Currently, she is a member of the communal bank “El Buen Samaritano” composed of 9 members that make their living in diverse commercial activities.

For the last 2 years Melania has worked in her own small grocery store where she sells groceries, etc. She started by selling a few products and with time was able to expand her business. She says it wasn't easy, as she had to work very hard together with her husband, but thanks to her hard work and dedication she has gotten better profits, her children have an education and above all they have a better quality of life. She says that as a woman, she feels very proud of herself and independent.

The loan she received was to buy goods (milk, pasta, rice etc.) Melania will fulfill all her goals with hard work and effort and the help of her loan with "Edaprospo"

Laura is the lady with the blue shirt in the upper left hand corner of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase goods (milk, pasta, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 27 years old, married, and has three children; all of whom are still in school. 

Veronica heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Munduru

texts.en:
Munduru lives in Yambio. She sells clothes and has been in business for one year. She is 25 years old, married, and has no children. 

Munduru heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: El Pantano Teupasenti Group

texts.es: José Luis tiene 44 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario El Pantano Teupasenti, tiene 4 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. El inicio su negocio desde hace 29 años, comenzó comprando un cerdo y con la poca ganancia que le quedaba iba comprando mas cerdos y en la actualidad se dedica al destazo de cerdos y vacas, también se dedica en menor escala al cultivo de café, el trabaja solo y cuando tiene mucho trabajo contrata empleados temporalmente para que le ayuden a realizar la labor.  José Luis esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de vacas para destazo. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá comprar lo suficiente para abastecer todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún problema con el negocio ya que casi no tiene competencia y el negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias. Una de sus metas es llegar a ser la persona principal y potencial en la zona con el negocio de destazo de cerdos y vacas. Este es el tercer préstamo que solicita en FAMA y ha sido muy puntual pagando sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José Luis is 44 years of age and a member of the El Pantano Teupasenti solidarity group. He has four children, and his wife is responsible for the household chores. 

José Luis started his business 29 years ago when he bought a pig. The small profits he made were used to buy more pigs, and he now works as a butcher of both pork and beef. He also works as a coffee grower on a smaller scale. He works alone, but when he has a lot of work he takes on temporary employees to help him carry out the work. 

José Luis has requested this loan to buy cows for butchering, and plans to buy enough to cover all his customers’ orders. He has not had any problems with his business as of yet as he barely has any competition, and his work generates very good income. 

One of his goals is to become the main and most successful pig and cow butcher in the area. This is his third loan from FAMA, and he has made his past repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 55-year-old widow from Jubeiha, Amman, Jordan who supports three members of her family.

Elham is making pastries and she works from her own house.

Elham is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase materials needed in making pastries. She is looking to establish her own shop so that she can increase her makrket share and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make pastries

loans.name: Divine Grace

texts.en:
Divine Grace is 22 years old and happily married to a farmer. They raise their family in a rural community while planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. They aim to earn more income to satisfy their necessities and save for their future. Due to financial difficulty, she engages herself in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

She planned to raise more pigs and improve her pig pen, but due to insufficient funds, she needs to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will help her meet her goals, and she hopes that she will make her business grow in the future.

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives in Yambio. She sells food at a stall and has been in business for four years. She is 28 years old, married, and has five children; three of whom are still in school. 

Veronica heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana lives in Yambio. She sells food at her food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children; two of her children are still in school. 

Susana heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from her sales to pay the school fees for her two children still in school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is 30 years old, a married man and father of three children, who lives in Ibb, Yemen.  He works hard to provide his family with a good and healthy lifestyle. He has been running a buffet for two years in which he offers his customers all types of products such as hot drinks, fresh juices and sandwiches. He worked in KSA (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia) until he had collected money for working capital. He has employed two workers in his business. He has been able to attract customers because of making all types of delicious foods and tasty juices which are produced by him. 

Nabil wants to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective. So, he  requested a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy his business needs such as cheese, eggs, fruits, beans, bread and spices, etc. In the future, Nabil would like to renovate his house to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy  cheese, eggs, fruit, beans, bread and spices, etc. for his business

loans.name: Jocen

texts.en:
Jocen is 29 years old and has one infant child. They live with her parent in a rural community planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to financial difficulties, Jocen is involve in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She aims to earn and save more income to satisfy their needs and to support the schooling of her child. 

She wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP10,000 to buy feed, vitamins, additional piglets to raise and materials needed to improve the pig pen. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the determination to improve and continue the business for she believes that her patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, additional piglets to raise and materials needed to improve the pig pen.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is 23 years old and a married man, living in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating an accessories store selling perfumes, cosmetic materials, etc. He worked in KSA (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia) until he collected a good working capital; then he traveled to his nation to open his business. He attributes its success to his being nice to his customers and selling quality goods at affordable prices. 

Hakim requested a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy more supplies like perfumes, cosmetic materials, etc. This improvement will enable him to increase his income. He hopes to open more than one accessories store so that will give him a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like perfumes, cosmetic materials and so on for his business

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is from the village of Alimanao. She is 30 years old, married, and has an infant. To make a living, Myla and her spouse manage a small water refilling service in their village. The couple obtains about PHP 5,000 monthly from their business. 

She is now taking out a loan of PHP 30,000 to maintain and buy plastic gallons to use in their water refilling service. She would like to keep generating good profits from their business and save money for her child's education. 

Myla's goal is not only to generate income from their business but to ensure the safeness of the water they distribute and maintain a good relationship with their customers.

loans.use: To maintain and buy plastic gallons to use in her water refilling services

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia lives in Yambio. She runs a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Lucia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, cooking oil, and salt. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
KOROTOUMOU est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle   vit dans une  famille traditionnelle  au quartier Hamdallaye A  de Ségou.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école pour des raisons sociales, (ses parents  voyaient l’école comme une source de déperdition sociale pour les filles), très tôt elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère  qui vendait des habits. 
Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle commença à faire le commerce d’articles divers, mais opta finalement pour les activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes imprimés et tissés traditionnellement depuis 23 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle   est à son 2ème  prêt individuel, après 1 prêt individuel correctement remboursé. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle  s’approvisionne à Bamako et effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle généralement féminine. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et d’aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Korotoumou is 53 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She lives in a traditional family in a neighborhood of Segou called Hamdallaye A.

For social reasons, Korotoumou never attended school (her parents believed that sending girls to school was a waste for society), so she got involved in income-generating activities very early in life and started helping her mother who was selling clothes.

Korotoumou spent several years learning her trade from her mother.  Then she started to sell various goods, before finally getting into buying and selling colorful printed fabrics and traditionally woven cloths.  She has been involved in this activity for the past 23 years.  She is very experienced in her field and has many customers.

Eager to boost her business and to increase her profits, she is requesting this new loan.  She has already duly repaid a first individual loan and this is her second individual loan.  With this new loan, she is planning to buy 25 sets of colorful wax fabrics.  She buys her merchandise in Bamako and sells for cash to a customer base which mostly consists of women.

Thanks to this loan, Korotoumou is expecting monthly profits to reach 100,000 CFA francs.  These profits will allow her to reimburse her loan, and to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to buy wax fabrics.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena, who has been a farmer for 15 years, assists her husband in order to minimize their labor costs. She really appreciates the goodness and humbleness of her husband.

Flomena owns farm land upon which she grows rice, an activity that allows her to support her children's education. She also runs a general store, and hopes that her two businesses will continue to grow. Flomena is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm supplies. She believes the loan will help her in attaining her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a hardworking and patient father and husband to Arcelie. His wife has been engaged in a livestock business; in particular the livestock business raises ducks and chickens.

Bernardo has been blessed with four children. One of them has settled for marriage; two are working and the youngest is still studying. Bernardo has been growing rice crops for more than 30 years. He plans to develop his farm land so that he can obtain greater profit so he can sustain his family's basic needs but he lacks the capital required to accomplish this. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of P15,000 allowing him to buy farm supplies to make his farm plot more productive. He hopes to have continuous access to the financial services from Kiva lenders through ASKI.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to improve his rice crop and farm land

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yambio. She sells items at a food stall and has been in business for one year. She is 20 years old, married, and has one child, who is not in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Farming is the main source of income of Noel’s family. He is proud to be a farmer because, through the income from his farm, he can support his family's needs.

Noel is married to Marcelina, who is a cradle maker in the village of Fugu Echague. Noel hopes to expand his farm and to increase his income because he would like his children to receive a higher level of education, and he wants to give his family a better standard of living. With regard to his plans, he is applying for a loan of P7,000, which will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for this planting season. Noel knows that he can maintain his farming business and make it more productive.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for this planting season.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Yambio. She sells food at a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Mariam heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, who is married to Tonimar, a farmer, owns a hectare plot of land upon which she has grown rice for more than eight years. Her main goal is to increase her income in order to improve their way of life.

The couple is working hard to achieve a plentiful yield and increased profit this next crop season. To attain those goals, Irene is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy farm inputs for her farming business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for her farming business.

loans.name: Nene

texts.fr:
Néné est âgée de 36 ans,  mariée  et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Néné fréquenta plutôt l’école coranique qu’elle abandonna  pour se marier. Elle débuta les activités  à  côté de ses parents qui sont des véritables commerçants connus de Ségou,  après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de ses derniers, elle évolua seule pour mener plusieurs activités. Elle finit par épouser la production et vente de jus de fruit, cette activité elle la mène depuis 10 ans et ses produits sont vendus dans beaucoup de kiosque de Ségou.
Pour augmenter son fonds, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est en relation depuis 24 mois. Après 2 prêts  individuels, correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 10 colis d’emballage, elle s’approvisionne à Bamako.
Néné  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, ce dernier lui servira de prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Néné is 36 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in a traditional family setting in the Médine district of Ségou (4th administrative district of the Republic of Mali).

Néné went to Koranic school before leaving to get married. She started working alongside her parents who are good, reputable dealers in Ségou. After several years of apprenticeship with them, she started working alone, undertaking many activities. She ended up devoting herself to the production and sales of fruit juice. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and her products are sold in many of the kiosks in Ségou.

To increase her capital, Néné turned to Soro Yiriwaso, an institution she has been with for 24 months. Having correctly repaid 2 individual loans, she is on her 3rd individual loan, which she plans to use to get 10 bundles of packaging material. She gets her supplies in Bamako.

Néné makes her sales for cash or credit to a clientele composed of women and men. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 100 000 francs which will enable her to cover certain family expenses.

loans.use: to buy packaging.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Benkola est un regroupement composé de femmes mariées et une célibataire, ayant en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des habillements, du savon, des chaussures et de la nourriture.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                              
La cliente MARIAM, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite, compte acheter avec les revendeurs de Barouéli, 50 cartons de savon BT et 20 cartons de savon Koulikoro, pour ensuite les vendre sur place à domicile et en ambulante dans la ville de Barouéli à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et dans la diversification de son activité en menant le commerce de l’arachide.
texts.en:
Benkola is a group made up of married women and one single woman with an average age of 34, on average 3 children and all living in extended, traditional family settings in the town of Barouéli, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). The women got to know each other through family and neighbourly relationships, and bonds of friendship. They sell clothing, soap, shoes and food. The women of the Benkola group are on their 11th group loan.

Mariam (2nd from the left in the photo) is planning on buying 50 cartons of BT soap and 20 cartons of Koulikoro soap from the resellers in Barouéli, so that she can sell them locally, door-to-door and on the streets of Barouéli, to a clientele made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 120 000 francs, which will be used to meet her family's needs and to diversify her business by adding groundnuts.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
AMINATA est âgée de 34 ans, mariée  et mère de 5  enfants. Elle   vit dans une  famille traditionnelle avec son mari et d’autres couples au quartier Bagadadji  de Ségou.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école pour des raisons sociales, (issue d’une famille très ancrée dans les valeurs ancestrales), elle commença très tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère  qui vendait du riz dans la zone rizicole de M’Bewani  dans la zone office du Niger. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage,  elle commence à évoluer seule  en menant les activités de vente d’habits, de bois de chauffe, de céréales, de jus de fruits, des yaourts, de l’encens, etc. Elle finit par opter se spécialiser dans le commerce de yaourt et la préparation et vente de jus de fruits depuis maintenant 5 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle. 
Pour faire son jus, elle a besoin de 10 kilos de sucre, 12 sachets de jus en poudre, 20 sachets de sucre valines et 6 kilos de gingembre.   
Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau congélateur et de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt.  Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois après un 1er prêt individuel correctement remboursé. Elle est à son 2ème prêt qu’elle compte utiliser,  pour acheter un congélateur et 2 sacs de sucre. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. 
AMINATA vend au comptant et en détail à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA qui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de mener autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Aminata is 34 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives in a traditional family setting with her husband and other couples in the district of Bagadadji, in Ségou. Due to social reasons (she comes from a family with well-established ancestral values), she did not go to school and became involved in revenue-generating activities at a young age, selling rice alongside her mother in the rice producing region of M’Bewani in the Niger Office zone. After several years of apprenticeship, she started working alone, selling products like clothing, firewood, cereal, fruit juice, yoghurt and incense. She ended up deciding to specialise in the sale of yoghurt and the production and sale of fruit juice, which she has been doing for 5 years now and has a significant customer base.

To make her juice she needs 10 kilos of sugar, 12 sachets of powdered juice, 20 sachets of valine sugar and 6 kilos of ginger. In order to be able to get a new freezer and to strengthen her business, she is requesting this new loan. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months, having already repaid an individual loan. This is her second loan, which she plans to use to buy a freezer and 2 bags of sugar. She gets her supplies locally.

Aminata sells her products for cash to a mixed retail clientele. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 150 000 francs which will enable her to replay the loan and carry out other revenue-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and 2 bags of sugar.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, qui ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, chef lieu de commune; Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de la poudre de henné, des habits, des miroirs et de la nourriture.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq précédents.
La cliente MARIAM, assise en boubou bleu, compte acheter avec les revendeurs de Barouéli ,  4 sacs de poudre de henné, destinée pour le Burkina et Fana. Elle achète des tissus au retour de Burkina, ces tissus sont vendus sur place à domicile dans la ville de Barouéli à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de henné et d’habillements.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of married women and widows who have an average age of 38, an average of 3 children and who all live in traditional family settings in the town of Barouéli, the district's main town in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). The women got to know each other through family and neighbourly relationships, and bonds of friendship. They sell henna power, clothing, mirrors and food. The women of the Benkadi group are on their 6th group loan, having correctly repaid the 5 previous ones.

Mariam (sitting, in a blue boubou) is planning to buy 4 bags of henna powder destined for Burkina and Fana from the resellers of Barouéli. She gets the fabrics on her return from Burkina and sells them locally door-to-door in Barouéli to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 110 000 francs, which will be used to meet the family's needs and to reinvest in her henna and clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy henna powder and fabrics.

loans.name: Purcila

texts.en:
Purcila lives in Yambio. She sells food at a stall and has been in business for one year. She is 22 years old, married, and has one child, who is not in school. 

Purcila heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a responsible housewife who is engaged in buying and selling of vegetables in the public market. She is 34 years old and has four school-age children. With her husband, they agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and be able to find a good job someday. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Marilou needs to strengthen her business to increase her income. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is requesting an additional loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional stock of tomatoes, cabbages, onions, eggplants and beans to sell. She mentioned that through this loan, she will be able to increase her product offerings and income as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of tomatoes, cabbages, onions, eggplants and beans to sell

loans.name: Ana Emilia

texts.es: Ana a sus 24 años tiene grandes aspiraciones, una de ellas es ser microempresaria. Vive en Duran en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes. La idea surgió a medida que sus aspiraciones crecieron y con ello tener un mejor porvenir para su familia. El trabajo lo hace en el transcurso del día hasta la noche. Pudimos observar en la entrevista que lo realiza de manera amena y amigable. Nos comenta que ese es el secreto de su éxito por eso tiene mucha clientela. Está casada con Roberto quien es guardia de seguridad. Tienen 2 niños de 5 y 1 año de edad, aun no están en la escuela pero el próximo año asistirán. Da gracias a Dios ya que su trabajo le beneficia para su cuidado. El crédito lo empleara en la compra de víveres, gaseosa, arroz, azúcar etc. a futuro le gustaría que su tienda sea la más grande del sector con un bazar para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, at 24 years old, has big aspirations. One of them is to be a micro-businesswoman. She lives in Duran where she has a general store. The idea emerged as her aspirations grew, and with it, the idea that she wants to have a better future for her family. 

She does her work throughout the day until night time. At the interview it was observed that she does it in a pleasant and friendly way. She says that is the secret to her success, and because of that she has a lot of customers. She is married to Roberto who is a security guard. They have two children, ages 5 and 1. They are not in school yet, but next year they will attend. 

She thanks God that her work benefits her well being. The loan will be used to buy supplies, sodas, rice, sugar, etc. In the future, she would like her store to be the biggest in the area with a dollar store to improve its profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies, sodas, rice and sugar

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is thirty-two years old. He is happily married and has been blessed with two children. Freddie is a farmer and has been in the business for the past twelve years.

He hopes to expand his farm land area so it will be possible for him to obtain greater profits. He will use these for his children's education and to improve their way of living. Freddie would be happy to see his children finish their bachelor's degrees because this will allow them to find better opportunities and better prepare their future.

Poverty and insufficient capital are the reasons why Freddie would like to borrow additional capital. He is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 which will be used to buy farm supplies to improve the growth of his crops. He believes that his business will continue to grow because he devotes all his time to making his farm land more productive.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma lives in Capatan with her spouse and two children. To make a living, she sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her village and she also cooks food for snacks. She had been in her business for over a year now and earns about PHP 7,000 each month. She would like to make her business more profitable so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy more fruits, cabbages, tomatoes and string beans to sell. 

She hopes to keep improving her income to save funds for her children's education. She will be very happy and proud to see them become professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, cabbages, tomatoes and string beans to sell.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a responsible wife and a loving mother of two. She is thirty-eight years old and married. To earn an income for the family, she operates a small store selling grocery items to the people in their village. She had been doing it for over four years and earns about PHP 5,000 each month. 

She is now borrowing a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy sardines, breads, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell in her store. This will help increase sales capacity and boost her profits too. 

Maria Theresa would like to keep making the business profitable so that she can earn funds to pay for her children's matriculation fees.

loans.use: to buy sardines, breads, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been involved in this kind of business since 1984 with the help of her husband Casimiro.

Fe and Casimiro have been blessed with three children. One has been settled for marriage while the other two are still studying. She is thankful because she has been able to repay her previous loan and now she is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000. She will use it to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and also will use some amount to pay for the cost of labor to transplant and prepare her farmland for planting. 

She hopes to have ongoing access to financial services so she can improve her financial stability. In this way, she hopes to send her two children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and pay the labor cost of transplanting and preparing her farmland for planting.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is fifty years old and resides together with her family in the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan. She is married to a Barangay Councilor and is blessed with five children. The couple helps each other send their three children to school. Their two elder children already finished their schooling and now have their own source of income. According to Aurea, she wants to give a good future to all her children since she doesn’t want them to be like her and not pursue their schooling. 

Aurea ventured into the hog-raising business five years ago. She sells grown-up hogs and earns income from it. She hopes that her business will further expand by raising more hogs. She seeks assistance from Kiva lenders who can help her improve and maintain her piggery. Aurea is asking to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 as her additional capital to buy feed and additional hogs to raise. It will surely help her in making her business progress.

loans.use: To buy feed and hogs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from San Miguel and there she runs her general store selling a variety of different products. She has been running this business for seven years. Carmen is married to Domingo, who is a farmer. The couple were blessed with four children. The eldest is already working, the second is still searching for a job and the other two are still studying. Carmen hopes that she can support her two children in finishing their studies.

Carmen plans to purchase a variety of merchandise but her capital is no longer enough due to her expenses in her hog raising and fishpond business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She knows that this amount of loan would really be of great impact in improving her general store and two other businesses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Try Hard Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Try Hard” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the second loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sia. Sia is age thirty-six; she was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For twenty years now, Sia has been selling clothes. With this loan, she will buy clothes at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Buyanbadrah

texts.en:
Buyanbadrah is a twenty-four-year-old man who lives with his wife and a five-month-old son in Uvs province in Western Mongolia. His wife is an elementary school teacher. Before he used to live with his brother, but now he is married and lives in his own beautiful ger, a traditional nomadic tent, together with his family. 

He started his taxi service business in 2008. In 2010 he got a loan from Xacbank and bought new car. He drives to all different directions and offers a good service at a good price in his new car. Due to the bad roads in the area, his car has broken down and he needs to buy some spare parts. 

Buyanbadrah is a diligent and active young man who says that "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing some spare parts for the car". 

The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Feature Progresss Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Future Progress” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are small-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in order to seek a loan of 1,200,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Yatta. Yatta was born in Kenema city forty-four years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Yatta sells slippers and has been a businesswoman for eight years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy dozens of slippers to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a patient and loving mother. She is now sixty years old and is married to Domitillo. Her husband raises hogs to fatten and breed for future sale while she manages a small store selling grocery items. During the daytime, she likes to make additional sales at the nearby school. Income from their businesses goes for meals and allowances of their children. The couple had eight children. Six of them are already married while the other two are still studying in college. 

Maria is now applying for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs and breads to sell. She hopes to keep extending her good customer services in order to acquire more customers and boost her sales. This way she will be able to save funds to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs and breads to sell in her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine runs a small store in Capatan. She patiently sells grocery items to the people in their village. She had been doing it for over six years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She aspires to improve her sales so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits, and soap to sell in her store. 

Someday, she hopes to keep growing as an entrepreneur and continuously increase income for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits, and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is twenty-three years old, married to Jeffrey and together they raise two children to be responsible and industrious. To earn an income, Belinda sells vegetables to the people in her village. She offers them on a house-to house basis because she has no stall to stock her merchandise. She has been doing this for almost three years now. 

She would like to improve her sales so she is borrowing PHP 5,000 to buy eggplants, cabbages, and tomatoes to sell. This will help boost her profits and allow her to save funds for her children's sustenance in school.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, cabbages, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is thirty-two years old, married, and with two children. He has provided motorcycle transport services to the people in his village for over three years now. He earns PHP 300 daily from his business. His income goes on daily meals and allowances for his children. 

He aspires to earn additional income so he is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and crude oil to use for the motorcycle. He also would like to ensure that all his passengers travel safely. Joan's main goal is to achieve a prosperous life for his family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil to use for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a very hardworking and loving woman. Being a mother, she can do anything to sustain the needs of her family. She has been engaged in hog-raising for five years. She fattens the pigs and sells them when they are big. Aside from hog-raising she also manages a small store in front of their house.

Prima is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy feed and piglets to raise and sell to have additional income so that she can fulfill the needs of her family.

In the future, Prima prays that her business will expand so that she can fulfill all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Hipolita

texts.en:
Farming has been Ma Hipolita's primary source of income. For the past twenty-one years, she has been raising rice crops. She is grateful because she is able to manage her time between her farming business, her family and her other business which is the weaving of cradles. She has been doing all these things because she would like to help her husband in earning income.

Ma. Hipolita is thankful because she is able to maintain a good track record. She is now on her third cycle of loans. Since she repaid her previous loan, she is now requesting another loan of PHP 15,000. She will utilize this amount to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for the cost of labor to transplant and prepare her farm plot land for planting. She hopes that she will obtain greater profits so she can improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for the cost of labor cost to transplant and prepare her land.

loans.name: Biacca

texts.en:
Biacca lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is twenty-two years old, married, and has two children; one of them is still in school. 

Biacca heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anhtsetseg

texts.en:
Anhtsetseg is a 32 year old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Govisumber province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is a graduate student. Her children go to the secondary school and a kindergarden. 

Anhtsetseg is running a hairdresser's salon business so far. It has been 3 years since she started. She attracts a lot of customers by her skill and good service. Anhtsetseg is a talented hairdresser who says "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing a car for my business. I have a further plan to make my business bigger". The total amount she is requesting is 3,700,000 MNT to buy car.

loans.use: To buy a car.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is an enterprising woman. She sells different kinds of merchandise within her community. She is twenty-nine years of age, married, and has two children. The eldest is studying while the youngest is still an infant. 

She has run her general store for three years and she is glad because she is able to earn an income of PHP 6,000 a month. She has to be both a father and a mother to her children because her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). She don't want to just wait for her husband's remittances so she patiently operates her general store and hog-raising business.

She plans to purchase more stocks of groceries for her general store. But her capital is not sufficient so she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000.She  hopes to expand her business further and to repay her loan. In addition she is also hoping to have a well established business someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont  en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Sèmèbougou dans la commune rurale de Pelengana, région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente du riz, d’articles divers (thé, pâtes alimentaires,...), des pagnes wax et bazins. Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de plus en plus croissante de la clientèle, elles ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 10ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame,  Awa (1ère femme debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes bazins de toutes qualités dans le village de Sèmèbougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter sept pièces de pagnes bazins teintées différemment. Elle s’approvisionne en bazins avec les teinturières de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes dans le village, en ambulant dans les villages voisins et à la foire du marché château de Ségou. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, prendre en charge la scolarisation des enfants et les besoins du foyer en condiments. A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans leur chef lieu de commune dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Most of the five women who compose the Danaya group are married in polygamous families.  They average 42 years of age and 4 children each, and they all live in the village of Sèmèbougou, in the rural commune of Pelengana, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through family, marriage and neighborhood ties.

These women buy and sell rice, wax and damask fabrics, and various other goods such as tea, pasta etc.  Eager to meet their customers' increasing needs, they have joined Soro Yiriwaso and this is their tenth solidarity loan.

Standing first from the left in the photo, Awa is an important seller of all grades of "bazin" or damask fabrics, in the village of Sèmèbougou as well as in the surrounding areas.  She is planning to use her loan to buy seven sets of "bazin" fabrics, all printed differently.  She buys damask fabrics from dyers in Ségou and resells them for cash or on credit to a customer base which, in her village, consists of both men and women.  She also sells as an itinerant retailer in nearby villages, as well as at the market by the Ségou water tower.

Thanks to this loan, Awa is expecting average monthly profits to reach 70,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to pay her children's school fees and to buy the condiments that her family needs.  Like the other women of the group, her goal is to use her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to buy a plot of land in her commune's main town, to eventually build a house.

loans.use: to buy damask fabrics.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina, from Capatan, has a business selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She has been doing it for over three years now. From her business, she acquires about PHP 3,000 each month. Tina is now twenty-three years old and has three children to sustain. Tina's spouse is her partner in managing the small business. 

Now Tina decide to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000 in addition to her working capital. She will buy eggplants, string beans, tomatoes and cabbages to sell. She promises to pay back her loan. Tina hopes to make her family live progressively through her hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, string beans, tomatoes and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, les sept femmes du groupe Badenya ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans la commune rurale de Pelengana  (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce  de condiments, des fruits et légumes et du savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  adhère à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bassan (2 ème femme en position debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une vendeuse des fruits et légumes de toutes les qualités (banane, pomme, orange, papaye, mangue…)  au marché château de Ségou.                                                                        Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6  Caisses de banane avec les forains de Koutiala au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile  et dans le marché château de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Bassan compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le complément de condiments de la famille.
texts.en:
Married within polygamous families, the seven women in Badenya group are on average 45 years old with three children. They live in the rural community of Pelengana  (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors and relatives. They are in the business of selling condiments, fruits, vegetables and soaps. In an effort to increase their working captial, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 1st round of financing.
