Mrs. Bassan (2nd woman standing on the left of the photo) is a seller of fruits and vegetables (bananas, apples, papayas, mangoes…) at the market Chateau in Segou.
She intends to buy six cases of bananas from the sellers at the wholesale market in Segou. She sells on account and on credit from her home and in the market Chateau in Segou to both men and women clients. Mrs. Bassan hopes that with the loan she can earn an average profit of 20,000 cfa francs which will be reinvested in the business and help take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase bananas.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent à Pelengana, chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (échalotes, tomates, poivres, …), bois de chauffe, mil et pagnes bazins. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce afin de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assetou (1ère femme en position debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de toutes sortes de condiments dans le marché Château de Ségou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1,300 tonnes d’échalotes avec les paysans dans la zone de l’office du Niger. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile dans le marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée  majoritairement de femmes. Madame Assetou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en soin de santé et  de scolarisation des enfants. Madame Assetou a pour objectif de devenir grossiste dans son activité avec cet appui de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in Benkadi group are mostly married within polygamous families. They are on average 45 years old and have three children. They are from Pelengana, center of the rural community in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, family friends, and business partners within the market Chateau Segou. They are in the business of selling condiments (shallots, tomatoes, peppers...), fire wood and bazin cloth.
In an effort to boost sales and restock their inventory, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 5th round of financing.
Mrs. Assetou (1st woman standing on the left of the photo) is a big seller of condiments at the market Château in Ségou.  She intends to buy 1,300 tons of shallots from the farmers in a Niger region. The condiments are resold to accounts and on credit at the market Château in Ségou to mostly women clients. Mrs. Assetou is planning with the loan to derive an average monthly profit of 70,000 cfa francs. The profits will be reinvested in the business and to take care of the health and schooling needs of her children. Mrs. Assetou's goal is to eventually become a wholesaler with the help of the Soro Yiriwaso loans.

loans.use: to purchase shallots.

loans.name: Abdulrhman

texts.en: Abdulrhman is a married 33-year-old man who lives with his four children in Sana'a, Yemen. In 2000, he opened a store for spices (baharat). He began by opening a small business with limited capital to buy shelves and make simple decorations to attract his customers. He is a hardworking man who prefers innovations. He has many customers and they appreciate him. He has a good reputation and a good credit history. He asked for funds of 600,000 YER from AMB to stock his store with basic needs products like beans, rice, flour, sugar, lentils, eggs, coffee, raisins, etc. He hopes to complete building a house and to buy a car.

loans.use: to stock his store with basic needs products like beans, rice, flour, sugar, lentils, eggs, coffee, raisins, etc

loans.name: Cathbert

texts.en: Cathbert is a 32-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent home and save for a wedding. He has been in the pub business for the last four years. After starting with 60,000 UGX in capital, he currently has 700,000 UGX. He has the hardship of inadequate capital to purchase stock and a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and expanding his business to new markets. Cathbert needs a loan to buy beers for resale.The photo was taken from his store which is next to the bar,the client expressed that he was uncomfortable taking a photo in the bar since there were a number of customers at the time.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita has been raising hogs for ten years. She is married to Johnny, and they are blessed with five grown-up children. Three of her children are married and have their own families while another is her helper on their farm and the youngest is currently studying.

Emelita aspires to succeed and lift her family from poverty. She says that the profits gained from the hogs she raises are just enough to cover all of their household expenditures. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of PHP 12,000, which would allow her to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that this loan amount would help her a lot because she could ensure proper growth of her hogs. 

Emelita would like to strengthen her hog-raising business to save for the education of her youngest child and to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is twenty-eight years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Monica heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yei. She sells medical supplies in a clinic, and she has been in this business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are still in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 3000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase drugs and syringes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and syringes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles Polygamiques, les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Bamanan kin de la ville de Markala  dans la région  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans les foires de Markala et  Ségou. Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des céréales (riz et mil), condiments (échalotes et gombo sec) et galette à base de niébé. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (1ère femme  assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment  de toutes les qualités (gombo sec, tomates, oignon, échalote, etc.…) à Markala.                                                                                           Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 kg d’échalote,  20 sacs de gombo sec et 5 corbeilles de tomate avec les paysans des villages environnants de Markala et de la zone office du Niger; La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Markala à une clientèle composée  majoritairement de Femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et épargner.
texts.en:
Predominantly married into polygamous families, the five women in the Benkadi group are on average 48 years old with five children. They live in the Bamanan kin district of the town of Markala in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship and their income-generating activities at fairs in Markala and Segou.

Group members trade grain cereals (rice and millet), condiments (onions and dried okra) and flat-cakes made from niebe (black-eyed peas). In order to increase their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the first woman seated on the right in photo) is a great seller of all kinds of condiments (dried okra, tomatoes, onions, shallots, etc, ...) in Markala.

She plans to use her loan to buy 200 kg of shallots, 20 bags of dried okra and 5 baskets of tomatoes, from farmers in surrounding villages in Markala and the Office du Niger area. The resale is made for cash and on credit, at home and at the market in Markala, to mainly women customers.

With this loan Mrs. Fatoumata expects an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, to be reinvested in the business and put into savings.

loans.use: Buy food condiments

loans.name: Nyètaa Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, les six femmes du groupe Nyètaa ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent à Pelengana, chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce des  pagnes de toutes qualités (bazins, wax et Fancy) et de jus de fruits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce afin de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marietou dite Mama (1ère femme en position debout sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse de Pagnes de toutes les qualités (Bazin, Wax, Fancy etc..). à Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de  Pagnes Wax avec les commerçants grossisses au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait en ambulant  au comptant et à crédit à domicile  et  aux différents marchés de Ségou à une clientèle composée  majoritairement d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Marietou dite Mama espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en soin de santé et  de scolarisation des enfants. A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Married within polygamous families, the six women in Nyètaa group are on average 45 years old with four children. They live in Pelengana, center of a rural community in the region of Ségou. They know each other as neighbors, family friends, and business partners within the market Chateau in Segou. They are in the business of selling fabric of different qualities (bazins, wax and fancy) and fruits. In an effort to boost sales and restock their inventory, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 5th round of financing.
Mrs. Marietou called Mama (1st woman standing on the right of the photograph) is a big seller of the fabrics (Bazin, Wax, Fancy) in Ségou. She intends to purchase 20 reams of wax fabric from wholesalers at the market in Ségou. She sells door to door on credit and at different markets in Segou to both men and women. Mama hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 cfa francs. The profits will be reinvested in the business and used to take care of her families health and schooling needs. Like her fellow group members, she hopes to buy a plot of land to build a home in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  femmes du groupe Kotognontala ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Bamanankin de la ville Markala Région de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le marché Markala et de Siribala. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, Poisson sec, gombo sec, mil et du bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (1ère femme assise sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) a un grand magasin de stockage de céréales à Markala.                                                                                                               Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 Sacs de mil  avec les paysans des villages environnants de Markala. La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Markala à une clientèle composée  majoritairement d’hommes. Madame Mariam compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
Most of the five women who compose the Kotognontala group are married in polygamous families. They average 44 years of age and 4 children each, and live in Bamanankin, a neighborhood of the commune of Markala, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through neighborhood ties and through their income-generating activities at the Markala and Siribala markets.

The members of this group sell dry fish, dry gombo (okra), millet and firewood.  In order to boost their businesses, they have joined Soro Yiriwaso and this is their second solidarity loan.

Sitting first from the left in the photo, Mariam owns a large shop in Markala in which she stores grains.

She is planning to use her loan to buy four sacks of millet from farmers in villages near Markala.  She resells for cash or on credit to a retail customer base which mostly consists of men.

Thanks to this loan, Mariam is expecting average monthly profits to reach 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to buy the condiments that her family needs.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of millet.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with five children. To make a living, Gina is busy managing her hog-raising business. She has been in this business for four years, and she earns about PHP 7,500 with each sale.  

At this time, Gina is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs. Gina hopes that she can get the amount she has requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics, textiles, etc to sew pants and shirts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Buchanan. She is 46 years old and married with five children between the ages of 7 and  22 who are in school and live at home. She did not go to school herself. 

For twenty years Esther has been selling rice, pepper, bitter ball (a local variety of eggplant), okra, and palm oil in the local market. She started this  business with money given to her by her mother, and she learned the business from her mother. Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 34 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is single with a two-year-old child who lives at home. She is a high school graduate

For the past five years, Agnes has been running a shop in her community where she sells a variety of groceries. She started her business as a "sell-pay." In this Liberian way of doing business, the proprietor takes the goods from the supplier, sells them, and keeps the profits, returning the principal to the supplier. Agnes is requesting a loan a to buy more rice, oil, milk, tomatoes, butter, bread, bouillon cubes, and other items for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman. She says nothing makes her smile like her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her business

loans.name: Christina Dorbor .

texts.en:
Christina is 37 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is married with two children, aged 11 and 14, who are in school and live at home. Christina is a junior student at a university.

For eight years now, Christina has been operating a shop where she sells cement. She started this business with money from her savings. At the time, she was selling palm oil, pepper, and bitter ball (a local variety of eggplant) around the marketplaces. She says she would give her goods to her customers during the week and collect her money during the weekends, because she was a high school student at the time.

Christina is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for her business. She enjoys her work because it guarantees her and makes her popular. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for her business

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety tiene 30 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Vive con su pareja, con quien tiene cuatro hijos; de los cuales dos son mayores e independientes, mientras que los menores (de 9 y 10 años), aun estudian y dependen de ella. La casa donde viven es propia, allí comparte sus días a lado de su pareja, quien se esfuerza mucho, al igual que ella, para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo es la venta de abarrotes, compra al por mayor por los precios más cómodos y los vende al menudeo. Además de esto, se dedica al alquiler de sus motocarros, uno lo maneja su hijo y el otro lo alquila, obteniendo ganancias por cada uno. Lleva en este negocio 4 años y lo hace sola, ya que su pareja se dedica a otras actividades. Su trabajo le permite disponer de su tiempo como a ella mejor le parece. Cuenta que no fue fácil al momento de emprender este negocio, ya que las dudas y los temores la embargaban, pero poco a poco fue tomando más fuerza y ahora es muy buena en lo que hace. Bety se propuso el objetivo de agrandar su tienda y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes.

Éste es su préstamo número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente más segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. También le agrada mucho trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará productos para su tienda. También mandará a arreglar sus motocarros, debido a que se han deteriorado por el mal estado de algunas calles de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Bety, age 30, is a good woman who is also friendly and very responsible.  She lives with her partner with whom she has four children.  Two of them are grown and independent, while the younger ones (ages 9 and 10) are students who are dependent on her.  Bety owns the house in which she lives.  There she spends her days along with her partner, who works just as hard as she does, so that they can provide a better quality of life.

Bety's business involves selling groceries.  She buys in bulk because the prices are more affordable and then sells at retail prices.  In addition to this, she rents out motorcycle taxis.  One is driven by her son and the other is rented out, but she generates income from both of them.  Bety has been in business for four years and works by herself since her partner engages in other activities.  Her work enables her to make use of her time as she sees fit.  It was not easy for her to start her business because of the doubts and fears that she held, but she slowly gained more strength and now is very good at what she does.  Bety set a goal to expand her store and offer more products to her customers.  

This will be her 16th loan with MFP.  Bety is pleased to know that she has financial support, which makes her feel more confident about advancing her business.  She promises once again, just like her previous loans, to complete her payments.  Bety also likes working with the other members of her Communal Bank because they are responsible and supportive.  The loan of 1,500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy products for her store.  She will also have her motorcycle taxis sent out for repairs since they have deteriorated as a result of the bad condition of the streets throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Asma Group

texts.en:
This group is called Asma and it consists of three women (Amal, Anisa and Hanan) and one man (Yahya). They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER. They have been operating different kinds businesses. 

Amal is a 24 years old. She is the second woman from the left in the photo. She is engaged and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a tailor who employs one woman. At first she bought a sewing machine to sew different ladies clothing like dresses, skirts, etc. She is working hard to save money to have a better life. She asked for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a new sewing machine for her business. Her personal goal is to educate her children. Her business goal is to expand her business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in West Point. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children who are presently in school and living at home. 

For five years now, Martha has been involved in selling fashion clothes. She has many customers because her business is in a very good location in the market. She started her business with a loan from her friends and she learned about clothing sales from her friends. A problem she faces is that the size of her shop is too small for her commodities. 

Martha is requesting a loan to buy fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses) and to expand the size of her shop. She plans to expand her business even more and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fashion clothes and expand the size of her shop

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 51 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells different products to members of her community. She has been in business for three years.

Aida is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, and condiments. She believes that with perseverance and this loan she can achieve her dream of enlarging her store.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 48 years old and is widowed. Juliana is thankful because she has been blessed with three children. To make a living, she started her general store, and she has been in this business for two years. Juliana says that being a single parent is very difficult, but she does her best to provide for her children's needs.

Right now, Juliana is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy additional grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted biscuits, candies, snack curls, and soft drinks to sell in her business. Juliana hopes that she can get the amount she has requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Helena M.

texts.en:
Helena lives in the Paynesville area. She is 42 years old and has six children between the ages of 4 and 20 years who are in school and live at home. Helena stopped her education in the 6th grade. She is married and her husband is a social worker.

For the past five years, Helena has been running a shop where she sells electronic accessories, hangers, and other items. She started this business with money that she received from her husband. A problem she faces is that sometimes customers are not available. Helena is requesting a loan to purchase more electronic accessories, hangers, and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hard-working and responsible person who lives in the Philippines. She is 42 years old and is married. Marivic has two children. Her spouse works as a farmer in their village to help her provide for their needs.

Marivic has been in the business of hog-raising for three years. She usually earns about PHP 7,500 with each sale. Right now, Marivic is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs. She hopes to expand her business to secure her children's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Abdulrhman

texts.en: Abdulrhman, 32, lives with his two children in Ibb, Yemen. It’s mentioned that the quality of life in his community is at the medium level. He has been operating a bookshop for six years. He started his business with limited capital of his own to open his bookshop. He has proposed expanding his store inventory.  Because of this, he’s asking for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy books, presents, clocks and other bookshop items. The loan will allow him to gradually improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy books, gift items and other items to sell

loans.name: Aletor

texts.en:
Aletor lives in Buchanan. She is 35 years old and married with six children between the ages of 6 and 19 who are in school and live at home. She did not go to school herself. 

For five years, Aletor has been selling rice, pepper, and palm oil in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and she learned the business from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, and palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 44 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a mason. They have three children between the ages of 19 and 30, all of whom live on their own. For the past fifteen years Sarah has been selling rice in the local market. Sometimes she buys at a very high price and she realizes a very low profit. Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase rice by the bag for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice for her business

loans.name: Daniel G.c.

texts.en: Daniel is 47 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. He is married with children ages 18 and 24. He is a high-school graduate. For the past four years, he has been operating a drugstore. Daniel started this business with assistance from his sister and learned this way of selling from his school. He enjoys his business because it helps him to save and have money for others to spend. He is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory (paracetamol, blood tonic, cough syrup, etc.) for his business. In the near future, he wants to expand his business into a clinic.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory (paracetamol, blood tonic, cough syrup, etc.) for his business

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en: Marietha is 28 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has a five-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. For the past twelve years Marietha has been selling charcoal in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business. In the future she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Marla

texts.en: Marla lives in Compound #3. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged 13 to 21 who are in school and live at home. She did not go to school. For the past ten years, she has been operating a table in the local market where she sells fashionable clothes (T-shirt, blouses, etc). She started this business with the help of her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashionable clothes for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes (T-shirt, blouses, etc) for her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 31 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have three children from 8 to 15 years old. They live at home and attend school. For the past 15 years, Marie has been operating a little restaurant where she sells Liberian food. She started this business with 4,500 Liberian dollars. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, fish, and spices for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, fish, and spices for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old and lives in Compound #3. She did not go to school. She is married and has four children between 5 and 17 years or age. They live at home and go to school. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past nine years she has been selling charcoal. She says she likes how fast her business goes, but the problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. She wants to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 45 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between the ages of 15 and 20. They live at home, and all of them are attending school. For the past 10 years, Mamie has been selling fish. A problem she faces is her customers who buy on credit and don’t pay on time. She started this business with money that was given to her by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for her business. She hopes to educate her children and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business

loans.name: Merecy

texts.en: Merecy is 18 years old, single, and lives in Compound #3. She says she has not attended school before, because her parents do not have the finances to support every one of them. She says that for two years now she has been involved in a business to help herself improve her living conditions. She started this business with a loan given to her by her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. Her plan is to go to school and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 21 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her three children who are between the ages of 2 and 8. Two of them are in school and she is a high school student.

For nine years now she has been selling fresh in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends.  She likes the profit she makes from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish for her business. Her plans are to  build a house.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 34 years old and live in Compound#3 with her four children between the ages of 6 and 18 who are in school. For the past two years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, onion, pepper, oil, and charcoal for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onion, pepper, oil, and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 33 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her four children who are between the ages of 6 and 14. They are in school, but she did not go to school.

For the past four years she has been selling slippers. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her business

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 45 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has five children between the ages of 19 and 31. All of them are attending school and living on their own. For the past 28 years, she has been selling rubber dishes (cups, plates, and bowls) in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) for her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 34 years old and live in Compound #3 with her husband and children. Her five children are in school and are between the ages of 5 and 17. She says she stopped her education in the 6th grade.She has been selling fish in the local market for 15 years. The problem she faces is that when all the fish does not sell, she has to dry it for the next day to sell and she also doesn't have enough income to sell quality fish like cassava fish, butter nose, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy quality fish for her business. Her plan is to educate her children .

loans.use: to buy quality fish for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha, 37 years old, lives in the Airport community. She is married and has four children between 7 and 13 years old. They are in school and live at home. Her husband is a doctor. For the past five years Martha has been  operating  a cook shop (restaurant) near the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase inventory ( pepper, fish, rice, onion, salt and oil) for her restaurant business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase inventory (pepper, fish, rice, onion, salt and oil) for her restaurant business

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu is 35 years old and lives in Airport Community. She is married  with four children, ages 9 to 18, who live at home and attend school. For the past 15 years, she been selling  flour, sugar, and cosmetics in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and cosmetics for her business. She is appreciative of her business because she is able to save every day. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en:
Carlina is from District 2. She is 50 years old and single. To make a living, Carlina owns and operates a business that makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling siomai (a kind of dimsum). She has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately PHP 15,000 a month. Carlina is requesting a new loan to buy ground meat, spices, and drinks for her business. She wants to further expand her business so that she can provide for the needs of her parents.

Carlina prays that her business will expand so that she can renovate her house to live comfortably with her parents.

loans.use: To buy ground meat, spices, and drinks for her business

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu lives in Airport and is 32 years old. She stopped her education in the 8th grade. She has two children aged 3 and 14. The oldest one is in school and both of them live at home.

For ten years she has been selling lapper (traditional cloths) and cosmetics in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lapper (traditional cloths) and cosmetics for her business. She likes the way her customers respond to her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lapper (traditional cloths) and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu, 38, lives in Airport Community, is married, and has four children, ages 2 to 16, who are in school and live at home. She is a college student. For the past five years she has been selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to become a business manager and educate her children in business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is from the village of District II, a province of Isabela. She is 39 years old. Jovelyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately PHP 12,000  a month for these activities. Jovelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, spices, snack foods, and beverages for her store to have additional income to sustain the needs of her family.

In the future, Jovelyn hopes that she can expand her business for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, spices, snack foods, and beverages for her store

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta lives in Airport community. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between the ages of 3 and 8, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past 3 years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food. She makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory (oil, pepper, onion, bitter balls**, and salt) for her restaurant. She plans to buy land and build a house. 

**eggplant-like vegetable

loans.use: to purchase more inventory (oil, pepper, onion, bitter balls, and salt) for her restaurant

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 47 years old and lives in Airport Community. She has a 9th grade education, is married, and has eight children ages 12 to 30  years old. Three are in school and live at home. She received money from her husband to start her business and has been involved in business for 25 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice for her business. Her plans are to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en: Krubo lives in the Airport Community. She is 48 years old and married with five children aged from 5 to 19. They are in school and live at home. Her husband works with Firestone. For the past 25 years, she has been selling rice, pepper, vita, sugar, salt, and other items at the local market. She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, vita, sugar, salt and other items for her business.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en: Lucina, 43, has a 9th grade education and lives in Airport with her five children, ages 16 to 24, who are in school and live at home. Her husband is a security guard. She has been selling palm oil in the local market. To make more profit and gain more customers, she is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business. She has plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Doedee

texts.en: Doedee lives in the Air Port community.  She is  41 years old, married, and has  two children ages 12 and 25. One is in school and lives at home, while the oldest one is living on his own. For the past 15 years Doedee has been selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She is encouraged by her business because it helps to support her home. Her plans are to improve her children's lives and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes  for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 40, has a 6th grade education, is married, and lives in Airport with her seven children, ages 11 to 20, who are in school. Her husband is a contractor. For 10 years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. One problem she faces is the high cost of transportation. In the future, she wants to become a house owner.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en:
Jameeleh is a conservative woman who asked one of her daughters, Khadija, to take her place in the photo.

Jameeleh, 52 years old, is a widow. She was left with two daughters. One of them is Khadija, a 21-year-old single lady. She is a student at one of the Jordanian universities majoring in water and environmental resources management and she is in her third year.

Since Jameeleh has no one except her daughters, she insists on providing them with everything she can give and wants to make sure that both of them get their degrees to be able to depend on themselves in the future. So Jameeleh has applied for this loan in order to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie lives in Compound #3. She is 33 years old and did not go to school. She is married with 2 children ages 1 and 21. One is in school and they all live at home.

She has been selling used clothes for 6 years. She has many customers and makes lots of profit. A problem she faces is her business is not in a good location.

She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 49 years old and married to Elmer. For the past two years, they have worked providing motorcycle transport services for a living. The couple usually earns about 7,000 PHP each month. 

Julieta is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy tires and crude oil to maintain her motorcycle to keep earning funds. She will use the profit from her loan to finance the education of her two children. Julieta hopes that she and her husband will achieve a prosperous life someday.

loans.use: to buy tires and crude oil

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 47 years old and is married to Pascual. The couple has five children. For the past three years, Anastacia has been running a business selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She sells her produce house-to-house and earns 5,000 PHP each month.

Anastacia is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy cabbages, eggplant, string beans, and tomatoes to sell. She will also purchase additional merchandise to help increase her earnings. Anastacia hopes to keep her business profitable to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, string beans, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 38 years old, married, and blessed with two children. One child is in the 6th grade, and the other one is in the 4th year of high school. In sending them to school, Violeta needs enough money to continue their studies. To support their needs, she engaged herself in a buying and selling business in their community. She sells vegetables every day and earns a net income of PHP 6,000 every month. She has been doing this activity for 15 years.

To exceed her net income each month, Violeta is now asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy additional goods to sell such as beans, okra, squash, camote tops, onions, and garlic. She is hoping to acquire more customers for these goods. By doing that, she would earn a higher income each month and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell such as beans, okra, squash, camote tops, onions, and garlic

loans.name: Irmel Thomasa

texts.en:
Irmel Thomasa is a housewife and a small entrepreneur. For more than three years, she has been selling grocery items to the people in her village and she earns 2,500 PHP each month. 

Irmel Thomasa is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy sardines, eggs, breads, soap and shampoo to sell in her store and increase her earnings. She hopes to keep improving her business to finance her three children's education through the college level so they can earn degrees. This will be their greatest asset in searching for good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, breads, soap, and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn and her family lives in Lanna, Enrile. Her spouse provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. He had been doing it for four years and earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. The couple has five children. Three attend school and the income from the transport services was just enough for the family's daily expenses for meals and allowances of their children. Now, Jocelyn is borrowing a loan of PHP7,000 to buy tires and to pay for franchise renewal. This will help to continuously operate transport services.

Jocelyn and her spouse is trying their best to give the best education for their children and attain success for the family.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for franchise renewal.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 55 years old and married with three children. His youngest child still attends school and the others have settled into marriage. Dominador runs a backyard hog-raising business and breeds and fattens hogs to sell to butchers in his village. He earns about 4,000 PHP each month. 

Dominador is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines. Though his business is small, he hopes to improve it for additional profits to someday achieve a fortunate life for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 48 years old and engaged in a buy and sell business. She sells vegetables such as camote tops, okra, squash, beans, munggo and potato. She has been doing this for 15 years. Within these years of operating her business, her eldest child finished college. She is saving for her two children's educations. As of now, they are not interested in their studies, because they experience an insufficient amount of everyday necessities. As they stated, they should meet their everyday needs first. 

To achieve this objective, Mercedes is asking for a loan amount of PHP 19,000 to buy vegetables such as okra and squash as additional goods to sell. Through selling these goods, she would be able to earn more than her usual income. By doing that, she can now save for the future of her two children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as okra and squash as additional goods to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 28 years old, married, and blessed with two children. To make a living, she sells vegetables at the market. She does this every day and earns PHP 150. This amount is not enough for their everyday needs. She wants to earn a higher profit than her usual income to provide not only for their everyday needs, but also to secure the future of their children.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP 16,000 to buy vegetables such as cabbage, okra, beans, and squash as additional goods to sell. She hopes through purchasing these goods, it will contribute to earning a higher profit. This would avoid her family from poverty.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as cabbage, okra, beans, and squash

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 44 years old and blessed with three school-aged children. To make a living, she helps her husband in finding money for their everyday necessities. She is in the business of buying and selling vegetables in the public market. She earns PHP 300 a day if it is market day, but if it is a regular day, she couldn’t even make her usual profit. 

Therefore, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to buy additional goods to sell such bitter melons, pechay, cabbage, and string beans. These goods would attract more customers and would help her earn a higher income. She hopes for the further improvement of her business to continue sending her three children to school.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell such bitter melons, pechay, cabbage, and string beans

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Since she has been 21 years old, Teresita has been engaged in a buy-and-sell business. She already knows the hardships of finding money to live, so she works hard to gain enough money for herself, especially for her family. In selling vegetables for a whole month, she earns PHP 6,000. Her eagerness to increase her usual income leads her to ask for a loan amount of PHP 19,000 to buy vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cabbage, beans, okra, ampalaya, and green leafy vegetables.

Through these goods, she would then earn a higher profit.  She assures to finish her only child in studies with her patient and hard-working abilities. For her, the hardship of earning seems very easy to endure, because she thinks that every ounce of her sacrifice is for her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cabbage, beans, okra, ampalaya, and green leafy vegetables

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is 32 years old and has been running a fruit and vegetable business for the past ten years. She is proud to improve her family’s lifestyle. To ensure continued improvement in their life, Sherlyn continues her business with patience and perseverance. Sherlyn sells at the market three times a week and disperses unsold produce by selling house-to-house, walking to nearby villages. This is exhausting, but fun, because she can reach the villages without transportation fare.

Sherlyn is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan to buy additional vegetables to sell such as beans, squash, eggplant, and okra. She hopes her loyal customers will continue to buy her goods which will help her achieve the possibility of lifting her family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as beans, squash, eggplant, and okra to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and married with four children. For the past six years, her spouse has provided motorcycle transport services to the people in the village where they live. Maria is a Barangay health worker. 

Maria is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan to maintain her husband's motorcycle by buying tires, gasoline, crude oil  to increase her family's earnings. Maria hopes to improve their small business to keep generating good profits and ensure safe travel for all their passengers. This will help them to acquire more passengers and increase their earnings. Someday, Maria hopes to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline, and crude oil

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of living, Leonida aims to improve her family's status of living to give her children a better life. She is 45 years old and has two school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer and they live happily in a village. She owns and manages a small variety store while her husband cultivates their farmland. They have agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. 


Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Leonida aims to improve her small variety store to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy sugar, soft drinks, oils, fish sauces, salt, rice, beverages and soaps to sell. She mentioned that her loan will enable her to increase her product offerings and income as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, oils, fish sauces, salt, rice, beverages and soaps to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda has spent 30 years operating her business of buying and selling fruits and vegetables. To further support the needs of her family, Leonarda is patiently doing such activity. With the business she runs, Leonarda needs additional working capital to maintain and continue operating her business. She is requesting a loan of P13,000 to purchase the in-demand vegetables such as bagio beans, cauliflower and string beans. She wishes to continue growing her business and providing a better way of living for her children.

loans.use: purchase the in-demand vegetables such as bagio beans, cauliflower and string beans.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 29 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is married and has two children. For the past three years, he has been working hard to manage his electrical materials shop where he sells lamps, power wire, etc. He traveled to KSA to work and collect enough money to open his business. He has been operating his business for five years and it is the main source of income.

To help expand his business, Mohammed has requested a youth loan of 250,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to buy more electrical materials like lamps, power wire, etc for resale and it will help him to generate greater profits and expand his business. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more electrical materials like lamps, power wire, etc for resale

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 58 years old and a widow.  She is gifted with five adult-age children, and lives with one of them in a rural community.  She works in hog-raising and vegetable vending to help her children with necessities, like financing her grand-children's education.

She planned to raise more pigs to sell but does not have enough capital.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines that are necessary in the hog-raising business.  She believes that the loan will help her improve her business, and hopes to be successful someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 38 years old, a mother of seven children. To make a living, she is engaged in selling vegetables in the market. Her profit every day, amounting to 300 PHP, is usually put toward their daily needs, but it is not enough to meet the needs of her seven children. 


For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell, such as squash, okra, beans and leafy vegetables. She hopes to earn more than her usual income for the future of her children, as well as to save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell, such as squash, okra, beans and leafy vegetables

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 40 years old and is married to Ben. The couple has two children. Elsie is an industrious woman who has been selling fruits and vegetables at the village where they live for two years now. Sometimes, she also plants eggplant and tomatoes to harvest and sell. Elsie sells her produce house-to-house because she does not have enough funds to rent a stall at the public market.

Elsie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy more vegetables to sell such as cabbages, string beans, onions, and bananas. With the good profits from her loan, Elsie will be able to pay her children's school fees so that they can finish their degrees and have better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, string beans, onions, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 53 years old, married and lives a simple life with her four children.  She sells fruits and vegetables in the market every day.  To offer more goods, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy cabbage, carrots, potatoes and squash.  With her daily profit, she could improve her business.  She could also provide for the needs of her family.  Anita is looking forward to the betterment of their lifestyle from the loan.

loans.use: buy vegetables for her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is now 53 and is married with five adult children. She lives happily in a rural community where she works planting rice and vegetables and raising livestock for sale. With the help of her husband, Teresita believes that they can improve their living conditions and give their children a better life. Due to high cost of commodities and transportation, Teresita hopes to improve her hog-raising business and increase her income. 

Teresita is requesting a 18,000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she can improve her business and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is an industrious mother and wife. She is 46 years old and has been operating her buy-and-sell business for three years. During these years of selling vegetables, she has provided her three children with things such as allowances and material needs. For her to meet the educational needs of her children, she is working hard selling in the market every day.


To continue to make progress, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy beans, okra, eggplant and cabbage as additional goods to sell. She hopes to earn a higher profit in order to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy beans, okra, eggplant and cabbage as additional goods to sell

loans.name: Venia

texts.en:
Venia is 38, is married and has three children. Her husband is a farm worker and has experience in managing his crops. The family lives in their own home in Cabisera 7, which is within the rural area of the municipality of Ilagan. They have electrical service to their residence.

For the past six years Venia has raised and fattened pigs. She then slaughters them and sells them at the local market. Together Venia and her husband are able to cover expenses.

Venia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from ASKI, which she will use to buy feed for the pigs and repair their sties as well as her own home. She will improve her family’s standard of living and satisfy more of their needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and repair their sties.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 57 years old and married with four children. For the past year and a half she has run a sari-sari (general store). She sells canned goods, snacks, home use products and beverages.

Milagros has requested a 3,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell. She hopes to earn more so as to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 52 years old with three school-aged children. She is a very industrious mother who helps her husband to find funds for their living. Merlyn operates a hog-fattening business. 

Due to financial difficulty, Merlyn is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine. She hopes that her loan will provide a better income to finance her children's schooling. Through her patience and hard work, Merlyn hopes to make a comfortable living and save for her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has been in her buy-and-sell business for ten years now. There are a lot of businessmen like her in this trade, but having competitors doesn't make her weak to continue her business; instead they serve as her inspiration. They make her stronger, although sometimes she earns little. She still remains optimistic.


She wants to increase her offered goods, but due to insufficient funds she has not been able to purchase them. For this reason, this 58-year-old businesswoman is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables such as eggplants, string beans and pechay. She hopes these products will attract customers to provide her a better income. This she would save for emergency purposes. Hopefully, she can earn more than her expected profits for the betterment of her business as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as eggplants, string beans and pechay

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and married, but unfortunately she was not given a chance to have her own child. Her longing to care for a child caused her to adopt a grandchild and send her to school. With the love in her, Wilma needs to work to provide for her adopted child. She runs a business where she buys and sells vegetables every day and she earns 150 PHP daily. Wilma uses her income to provide for her family's every day needs, such as rice, and has not been able to save for her adopted child. 

Therefore, Wilma is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional vegetables to sell such as eggplant, pechay (bok choy), and squash. She hopes to increase her income with her loan. Wilma hopes to save for the education of her loving child.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell such as eggplant, pechay, and squash

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a mother who runs a small variety store in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is 41 years old and was gifted with only one child. Her husband is a farmer who operates their farmland. Their ambition in life is to become successful in the future to give their child a better life. Despite problems and difficulties in life, they have the determination to achieve their goals.

Rosemarie aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks of oils, sugar, salt, detergent soaps, soft drinks, and breads to sell. She believes that her patience and hard work will enable her to improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of oils, sugar, salt, detergent soaps, soft drinks, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 40 years old, married and blessed with four children. To earn an income, she sells vegetables to the people in her village. She patiently does this activity every day in order to sustain their daily needs. 

She would like to improve her sales so she is borrowing a loan of P14,000 to buy tomatoes, eggplants and string beans to sell. This will help boost up her proceeds and enable her to save funds for the development of their living situation.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggplants and string beans to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, 55, runs a small retail store which is her main source of income. She generates an income of PHP 150 a day that is usually used up as allowance for her three children. She aspires for higher sales in order to meet her family's day-to-day needs. 

In connection to this, she is asking a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase noodles, eggs, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell in her store. She hopes to keep her business growing which should help her lead a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, eggs, biscuits, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 28 years old and a mother of two. She is mainly involved in planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to financial difficulty, she also engages in hog-raising to generate additional income. She aims to uplift her lifestyle and educate her children to provide them a bright future. 

With this reason, Sharon hopes to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income. Due to inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines required to raise hogs. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her business and she hopes that she will be successful in working out her plan.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for raising hogs

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a mother who has the patience and strong determination to uplift her family's status of living despite crisis and problems she encountered in life. She is 44 years old and has two school-age children. With her husband, she plans to educate their children and give them a better life. To earn a living, her husband manages their rice farming business while Adelaida engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income.

Adelaida plans to improve her pig pen and acquire more pigs to raise. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise. She hopes that her loan will help to improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Edna wants to earn and save more money to ensure a good future. Edna is 32 years old and still single. She lives with her parents and manages a small variety store where she sells snacks. She has been operating this business for almost 3 years now and earns a profit of PHP 5,000 that is used for meeting her daily needs as well as save for her future. 

She aims to improve her small variety store and acquire additional stocks of grocery items to sell. Due to insufficient capital, Edna is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, junk foods, eggs, vinegar and rice for sale. She hopes that someday she will see her business grow and that the business will become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, junk foods, eggs, vinegar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is a 27-year-old married man with three school-aged children. Marlon engages in hog raising and fattening pigs until the pigs reach five months of age. Marlon is a hardworking father, and aside from his hog-raising he also manages a small farm with the help of his wife Gina. He is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy pigs and feed for his business expansion. He hopes he can achieve his dream for the benefit of his children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for his business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has been operating her small store at Annafunan. She lives with her spouse and four children. Through her income, she has been able to give daily allowances to her children. Two of her children hold a degree and are currently employed in the city. She has been patiently involved in selling grocery items to make profits. She would like to keep improving her sales, so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 23,000 to invest in her business. She will buy three cases of soft drinks, coffee, breads, eggs, sugar and noodles to sell in her store. This will help increase the sales. 

Someday, with enough funds, she hopes to establish a small eatery business beside her store for additional income, which should help her achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy three cases of soft drinks, coffee, breads, eggs, sugar and noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a very diligent and loving person. He is 36 years old. He is from the Qurino province of Isabela. He lives with his wife, Myrachel, and three grown-up children. Aside from hog raising, Ronald is also engaged in corn farming. Ronald is focusing on raising and fattening pigs to sell in the future. Ronald says in fattening pigs, he can see the impact of selling them. Because of this, he can send his children to school. For that reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy a piglet and feed for his business so that he can have additional income and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a piglet and feed for his business

loans.name: Jessabel

texts.en:
Jessabel is thirty years old, married and has a baby. The family lives in a rural community. She raises pigs while taking care of the baby, and her husband works as a rice farmer.

Jessabel is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her hog-raising endeavor. Her ambition is to earn more to satisfy the family’s needs and save some for the future of her child.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 52 years old, married and has two children. The youngest attends school while the eldest is married. She is involved in a direct selling business from which she makes money. She sells cosmetics and perfumes through a catalog. She would like to make her business profitable so she is asking a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy perfumes, powder, make-up and lotions to sell.

Someday, with good profits from the business, she wants to start a hog-raising business as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, powder, make up and lotion to sell.

loans.name: Berna Joy

texts.en: Berna Joy is married and has two grown-up children. Her spouse is engaged in a farming business. Berna Joy has been fattening pigs for five years. To help her provide for her family's needs, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy vitamins and feed. In the future, Berna Joy hopes that her business will expand so that she can renovate her house and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and feed for her business

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a 25-year-old lady. She is single and a very responsible daughter. She makes sure that she can provide for the needs of her parents. Judy is engaged in a hog raising business. She fattens the pigs, and after five months, she sells them. To have some additional income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy two piglets to raise and fatten them. Judy hopes that her business will expand so that she can save for her family, and at the same time, provide for the needs of her parents.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets for her business

loans.name: Aldrich

texts.en:
Aldrich is single and a responsible son. He has been a farmer for over ten years. He also raises pigs to sell. He feeds his pigs with field leavings.

Aldrich is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan from ASKI. He intends to use the loan to buy two pigs and corn for sowing in his fields. He relies on your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and corn for sowing in his fields.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is married and has two children. He buys and sells pigs. Gilbert has been in this business for seven years and is successful in it. He started the business with two pigs and gradually expanded his business. At this time, he has five pigs. He wants to receive a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs. He is thanking everyone in advance for their support and help. Thank you very much.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a 33-year-old woman who lives in the Isabela province of Ilagan. She started this business nine years ago. She expanded her business by selling beauty products in the community. Her business activities are the main source of income for her family. She is trying really hard to continue her business successfully. She needs to pay for her daughter's school fees and other expenses by having successful business activities.

She is a humble woman who says, "I would like to request this loan to expand my business by purchasing the necessary materials for my personal products supply business." The total amount she is requesting is PHP 17,000 to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: To purchase lotion, make-up, and shoes for her business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 48-year-old single man. He sells different products in the community. He is a very patient person, and he provides for the needs of his parents. To save for his future, he is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, and spices for his sari-sari store (a community-based store). In the future, he hopes that he can expand his business so that he can save for his future, and at the same time, sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy snack foods, drinks, and spices for his store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca lives in Cabisera 7. She is married and 46 years old. She has two children who are 7 and 18 years old. They are in school and live at home. Her husband is a farmer. For the past ten years, she has been running a provision shop, which sells rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissue, milk, batteries, and many other items. She says some problems she is facing are the location of her shop and having fewer commodities. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of business from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory (rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissue, milk, batteries, and many other items) for her shop. She says that she is happy about her business for so many reasons: it keeps her busy, it builds her trust, and it makes her well-known (every one in her community looks up to her for help if the community needs it). She smiles as she says her plan is to expand her business and empower others with her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissue, milk, batteries, and many other items for her shop

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en: Adriana is married and has two children. She is involved in hog raising, and she has been in this business for five years. She has two pigs, one calf, and three goats in her business. She makes a profit of about PHP 5,000 each month from selling her animals. She intends to continue developing her animal husbandry business. In order to further grow her business, Adriana has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy additional livestock. She plans to invest her earnings from the loan into a continued increase of livestock.

loans.use: To buy a pig for her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 57 years old and a widow. She is a very hard-working mother of three. Her children attend school. She is sure that she can provide for the needs of her family. Milagros works at home and sells personal use products like AVON, MSE, and Natasha. She has a retail business with the help of her children. She is managing to succeed in this business.

She has applied for a loan to buy more products like clothes, sheets, shoes, umbrellas, and covers.

loans.use: To buy sheets, shoes, umbrellas, and covers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Evelyn is involved in a rice farming business to generate income. Also, she owns and operates a small store located in a community where her husband is a farmer. She sells snacks, sweets, and beverages to the people and earns a suitable income, which she spends on food and allowances for her children.

To improve her business, she is now asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase snacks, sweets, biscuits, and other merchandise to sell in her store. She hopes that the loan will enable her to make improvements to this business and make it a viable source of income. Evelyn would be glad if her requested loan amount is approved.

loans.use: To purchase snacks, sweets, biscuits, and other merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Emerito

texts.en:
Emerito raises crops, particularly planting and harvesting rice in his one-hectare rice field. Emerito has been doing this for over 20 years and earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season. He still wanted to improve his farming practices and his output as well. 

Emerito is now 43 years old, married to Edna and they have four children. Two attend elementary school and two are in high school. All he wanted is to get the best education for them. This time, he is borrowing a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help ensure good crop growth. 

Emerito hopes to achieve an abundant harvest to save funds for his children's college educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her husband and one child in Isabela province. Her child studies at the primary school, and her husband is unemployed. She started a store in 2000. Previously, she ran a grocery business for 12 years.

The business income is stable, and Emma has gained many regular customers. She purchases her store supplies wholesale. 

"I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing supplies in large quantities," said this diligent and hardworking woman. "I am planning to save for my family."

The total amount she is requesting is 8000 PHP to buy food supplies like spices, noodles, drinks and rice.

loans.use: to buy food supplies like spices, noodles, drinks and rice.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 41 years old, married and has four children. Three of them attend school. To give sustenance for his family, he patiently raise crops to sell. He is a rice grower in the village where they live. From his two hectare rice field, he generates about 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each harvest season (twice a year). It goes for meals, allowances and bills at home. Shirley, his wife, raises hogs as a business. Together, they work hard for the family's sustenance. 

Now he is borrowing a loan of 50,000 PHP for maintenance of the farming business. He will buy eight bags of UREA (fertilizers) and pesticides used in farming. This way he will ensure good crop growth. He hopes to produce an abundant harvest to increase his earnings. 

Edgar's main goal in life is to give the best education for his children and someday achieve a fortunate life for his family.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of UREA (fertilizers) and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Ruby Jhane

texts.en: Ruby Jhane is a 25-year-old mother of two children attending school. She has been operating a grocery for the last year, selling her goods in the community. Other sources of income include sales from farm produce. Ruby Jhane describes community competition to be her major challenge and she dreams of opening a kiosk in the future. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. She joined ASI to get access to loans. Ruby Jhane spends more on food over the month. With the loan of 7,000  Philippine pesos (PHP) she plans to purchase canned goods, spices and snack food.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, spices and snack food

loans.name: Galawezh's Group

texts.en:
Galawezh is a 46-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and with her husband she is raising three children.
