By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Hoy is 51 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her daughter is employed as a sales representative. She earns about $5 per day. Due to her family's transportation difficulties, Hoy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 37-year-old divorced woman and mother to three sons and three daughters who live with her. For the past five years, Eman has been operating a beauty salon located in the city's center, which is a good movement area, and her beauty salon has been profitable. But it is the only source of income for Eman and her children, and it needs more support to cover her family's needs and the costs.

Eman gives beauty training courses in her salon to women who wish to open beauty salons in the future, so Eman wants to expand her beauty salon by adding new decorations to the side that will be used for holding training courses.

Eman is requesting a 1,400 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of installing new decorations and improving the salon's condition. This will fund a suitable space to hold training courses in, increase the number of trainees and improve the family's income.
  
Eman is photographed in her beauty salon.

loans.use: To expand her beauty salon by adding new decorations.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim is 51 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 per day. Khim is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for her son’s passport expenses. This money will help her son work in Thailand legally and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's passport expenses.

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Hol is 48 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $4 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. Hol wants to run an additional business to earn more income to support her family. With this goal in mind, Hol is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation. This money will help her acquire the security to start her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to use for agricultural crops cultivation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and she has been in business for two years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is 39 years old. She is the mother of six children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been producing soybean milk for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day from their sales. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $10 per day. Phally is requesting a loan of $1300 to pay for her daughter’s passport expenses. This money will help her daughter to work in Thailand legally and earn more income to support the family. In the future, Phally would like to expand her business and help her children obtain higher education to get good jobs. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's passport expenses

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 37-year-old man. He is married with no children yet. He is a taxi driver who gets a salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs and their expenses.

Mohammad is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more construction supplies to complete building his house and improving its condition. This will enable Mohammad and his family to complete building their house and live in a healthy and suitable condition.

Mohammad is photographed in the location of his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to complete building his house

loans.name: Phol

texts.en: Phol is 25 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. Her children are still in her care. Because the present motorbike is old, Phol is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase will help her husband attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate extra income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and she has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has one child, who is not in school. 

Esther heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Syd Charisse

texts.en: 31 year-old Syd-Charisse has been working hard at her rice farming business in the village of San Juan for ten years. She has been gaining successes in this business with her enterprising nature and unfailing diligence. She sells most of her crops to the buying station for corn and rice in their town. Syd-Charisse is happily married and has two good-natured children. Her children are in school and doing well.  She says her sales return total Php 30,000 per crop. Her hope is that, once she puts her loan proceeds into good and efficient use, her business's prospects will see a new lease on life. She wants all the best for her family and business and she says she will go to every length, not only to improve on their current circumstances, but also to ensure that they all will enjoy a good and prosperous future. Syd Charisse is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She says she will use this loan to purchase high grade manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Sok Nim

texts.en: Sok Nim is 42 years old. She is the mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sok Nim is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store from her home and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei. She sells food at a stall, and she has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children (two of them are still in school).
 
Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Yeum

texts.en:
Yeum is 39 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying cattle to resell for a profitable price. He earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Yeum is requesting a loan of $1000 for her husband to purchase more cattle to sell. By doing so, he should earn more profit to support the family. In the future, Yeum would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell

loans.name: Perisita

texts.en:
Perisita lives in Yei. She sells fish, and she has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Perisita heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Chantho

texts.en: Chantho is 33 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been producing palm sugar for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a palm fruit and coconut vendor who earns about $5 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Chantho is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying palm fruit and coconuts to sell. This purchase will help her husband carry palm fruit and coconuts to sell in larger amounts and earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying palm fruit and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Sophear

texts.en: Sophear is 32 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than two years and is successful in her career. She is involved in fattening up pigs and poultry. She earns about $7 per day. Her husband is truck driver who earns about $15 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. Because their current truck is old, Sophear is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new truck for her husband's delivery service. This purchase would enable her husband to attract more customers and earn more money to support the family. In the future, Sophear would like to purchase one more truck to run the service and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck for her husband to run his delivery service

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells fish, and she has been in business for two years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 43 years old, and her husband, Von, is 43 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990, and they have three daughters--two are garment workers, and the other one is attending school. 

Mom and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband also does construction work when he is not at the farm. Mom is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to fill in the land behind her house. There are some small ponds, so she needs to fill them in.   

Photo: Mom is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
At an early age, Pedro started to farm due to the living status of his family. With regards to his situation, Pedro doesn’t want to let his children experience what he went through, because he would like to see them have a good future someday.

To make his dreams come true, Pedro devotes his time to his corn field so that he can improve the growth of his corn crop and expand the farmland he manages. Pedro is a responsible father to his three children and a loving husband to Lydia. Aside from his farming business, Pedro has also involved himself in a hog raising business for more than 20 years. He is grateful, because the generated income from his farming business was used for his eldest child's education, and some was used for their household expenses. He plans to buy feed, because his place is far from the market, and he wants to economize his expenses in going to and from the market. To obtain his dreams, which is to uplift his living status out of poverty, he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. He hopes that the KIVA lenders and ASKI will grant his request for the loan amount.

loans.use: To buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito has run his hog-raising business since 2011. He currently is raising seven hogs to be fattened and sold. Before he he started raising hogs, he operated his farming business. He grows corn. For 30 years he has sacrificed to devote himself his farmland in order to make it more productive.

Benito is confident that his business will continue to grow, because he has been doing his best to provide his hogs with proper nutrition. He hopes to make his hogs healthy upon reaching their optimum growth. With his determination to improve the family's living conditions and to provide his child with a higher level of education, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. He will use the funds to purchase livestock feeds for his hog-raising business.This capital will eventually help him a lot, especially in improving his financial stability and improving his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds for his hog-raising business

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat is 58 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling rice and vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $2 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Phat is requesting a loan of $800 to raise capital in her business to purchase more rice and vegetables for resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more rice and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a forty-six-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling bananas for ten years. He started with one acre and now has four acres. His business challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to hire employees to help expand the business. Geofrey is requesting this loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Wakinime

texts.fr:
Wakinime est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un étanchéiste/architecte. Elle a 01 enfant de 17ans qui va à l’école
Wakinime travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2004. Elle exerce dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Wakinime a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut acheter un terrain pour construire une maison. Elle veut devenir grossiste et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille.
texts.en:
Wakinime is a 35 year-old woman.  She is married to an architect specialized in waterproofing.  She has one 17-year-old child who attends school.

Wakinine has been working as a reseller of general food products since 2004.  She works in a shop and buys her merchandise in Lomé.

Wakinine has received her second loan from WAGES for the purchase of general food products.  She wants to buy a plot of land to build a house.  She wants to become a wholesaler and provide a bright future to her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 38-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and three daughters. All of his children are school students.

For the past twenty years, Bassam has been selling baked goods and different types of sweets. This has been a profitable project, but he also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Bassam is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new sweets templates and a new stove. Taking this loan will enable Bassam to improve the quality of his baked goods and sweets and to satisfy his customers. This will lead to an increase in production and so increase sales and improve the family's income.

Bassam is photographed in his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase new sweets templates and a new stove.

loans.name: Sam Oun

texts.en: Sam Oun is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam Oun is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase farmland for cultivating crops. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating crops

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Vanny is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and her child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $7 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Vanny is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business, which is involved in animal husbandry, to earn extra income for the family and to send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 42 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling fruit for more than seven years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fruits for resale. By doing so, she will earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Mayamou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1990, MAYAMOU vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de SANANKOROBA. 
MAYAMOU s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. MAYAMOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales : niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, dah etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les cinq prêts précédents, MAYAMOU est à son sixième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 sacs de grain de néré, auprès des paysans faisant la cueillette (à SANANKOROBA, Tiélé et Bancouman) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de SANANKOROBA et à BAMAKO à une clientèle composée essentiellement de transformatrices de néré en Sounbala. 
MAYAMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1990, Mayamou lives with her husband and her six children in an extended traditional family in the rural commune of Sanankoroba.

From a young age, Mayamou became interested in income-generating activities, and she learned her trade while working several years beside her aunt who was selling various goods.  She later chose to buy and sell grains such as niébé (cowpea), millet, fonio, maize, dah (seeds from the Roselle plant) etc.

Having duly repaid five previous loans, Mayamou is now on her sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  She will use this loan to purchase 100 sacks of néré seeds from the villages of Sanankoroba, Tiélé and Bancouman where people pick néré fruits, and additionally, although much less frequently, from local wholesalers.  

She sells for cash and on credit, from her home, as well as at the Sanankoroba market and in Bamako, to a retail customer base which mostly consists of women who process néré fruits into Soumbala.

Mayamou is hoping to make a monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs which will be used to help her husband provide for the family, to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy néré seeds.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a 25-year-old married mother of one son and two daughters; her husband is a worker earning a low salary which is insufficient to cover the family's costs and expenses.

Ghadeer's son requires immediate eye surgery lest he go blind, and so she is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her pay for his medical expenses. Treatment will allow him to live normally with the family.

Ghadeer is photographed in the picture with her husband and her children.

loans.use: to pay her son's medical expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells fish, and she has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 900 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
Herminigildo is a farmer who raises corn on his two hectares of field. He is 51 years old, married, and blessed with four children. According to him, only his youngest child went to college, and he is about to finish the coursework for his degree. His other two children are already working and helping him financially to provide the family's daily necessities.

Herminigildo is also raises hogs within his local community. He is a man full of hopes for his youngest child. He aims to develop his hog-raising business, but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed and vaccines. He hopes to earn a higher income and save some of it for the family's future emergencies. He hopes that his loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Née  vers 1979 à SANANKOROBA, OUMOU vit avec ses 5 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame à SANANKOROBA. 
OUMOU n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait les grillades : brochettes de bœuf avec du pain. OUMOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes les activités à savoir le petite restauration avec la préparation et vente de brochettes de boeuf, de sandwich, de l’atieké, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents, OUMOU est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, de la viande des condiments pour sa préparation et de l’atieké. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, au marché de SANANKOROBA à une clientèle mixte. 
OUMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Sanankoroba, Oumou lives with her five children and spouse in a monogamous family in Sanankoroba.

Oumou did not have the opportunity to attend school, she became interested early on in earning money by doing business along with her older sister  making "grillades": beef kebabs with bread.  Oumou, after years of experience with this, opted to start a similar business dealing mostly with small meals, preparing and selling beef kebabs, sandwiches, "attiéké" [dish made from cassava], etc.

After having propely repaid her two previous loans, Oumou is on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which she will use to purchase meat and condiments for her food preparation and for making attiéké.  She buys locally and sells retail out of a market in Sanankoroba to a mixed clientele, both in cash and in credit.

Oumou would like to earn a monthly income of 60,000 FCFA, which will be used to help her husband take care of the needs of the family, pay back her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is 61 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for more than twenty years and is successful in her career. She is grows rice and fattens up animals. She earns about $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are employed. They earn about $13 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Neang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle for resale. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for resale

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy is a 56-year-old hardworking lady who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children. She has been in the cattle-selling business for the last five years. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock; however, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. She has applied for a loan to help her buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle to resell

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 34-year-old man. He is married and the father of one son and three daughters. He is employed, but the salary he earns isn't enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Shadi has also been selling groceries. It has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs of his business.

Shadi is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary groceries currently missing from his inventory, such as canned food, milk, and rice. This loan will allow Shadi to offer a wide selection of groceries that his customers usually request and buy, which will increase his sales and improve the family's income.

Shadi is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase necessary groceries to sell

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1982 à Bamako, RAMATA vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite RAMATA s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus, son premier prêt a été bien remboursé et elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel destiné à la constitution de stock de condiments et denrées alimentaires pour la restauration. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt, 60  kilogrammes de condiments, une tonne de céréales diverses et de tubercules pour servir pendant longtemps sans pénurie et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA pour rembourser les échéances du prêt et investir dans ses affaires.
Elle compte toujours sur l’appui financier de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’ouverture de nouvel restaurant en d’autre localité où le besoin se pose et aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités
texts.en:
Born around 1982 in Bamako, Ramata lives with her three children and her husband in a nuclear family in the rural commune of Ouelessebougou.

Not having had the chance to progress in her studies, Ramata got interested in income-generating activities at a young age.  Her first loan was duly repaid and she is now on her second individual loan, which will be used to constitute a stock of condiments and food supplies for her restaurant.  

Ramata buys her supplies once a week in Bamako and, with this loan, she is planning to purchase 60 kgs of condiments and 1,000 kgs of various grains and tubers, in order to be able to serve [her customers] for a long period of time without experiencing any shortage of food.  She is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs, which will be used to invest in her business and to repay her loan according to the repayment schedule. 

Ramata is also counting on Soro Yiriwaso's financial support to open a new restaurant in a different locality, where this type of business is needed.  With financial assistance she will also support her husband in providing for the family; she will repay her loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nadjegueton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe    NADJEGUETON 3 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et     Diakalia   assis au milieu, sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The member of NADJEGUETON 3 are married men, averaging 49 years of age and six children. They all live in traditional families in Flazambougou, a village in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be successful with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. Their crops is corn.
Diakalia, sitting in the middle in the photograph, intends to use his part of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay labor costs to maintain 1 hectare of land.
After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising mostly resellers from the larger cities.
Diakalia intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 230) per farming cycle, to be used to repay the loan, and also support the daily expenses of his large family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay labor costs

loans.name: Katiereton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Katiereton 2 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et  Ousmane   2eme debout de la droite vers la gauche, sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Katiereton 2 is a group composed of married men who average 45 years of age and 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.They grow corn. With this loan, Ousmane (the second person from the right on the picture, standing), plans on buying fertilizers and seeds and on paying for the workforce to take care of 5 acres of land.
The crop is sold in the village, in the market of Sikasso to a client-base composed mainly of resellers from the big cities.
His goal is an average profit of around 300 000F CFA per harvest.This profit will enable him to reimburse his loan and help with his big family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for workforce

loans.name: Mawouena

texts.fr: Femme de 56ans, Madame Mawouena est mère de 03 enfants qui sont plus à l’école. Le premier a 39ans et le dernier 35ans. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes au marché depuis 2007. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sollicite ce second crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pagnes. Son désir est de croitre son activité en ouvrant une boutique et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mawouena is a 56-year-old woman and mother of three children who no longer attend school. Her eldest child is 39 years old and her youngest child is 35 years old. 

She has been selling colorful West African cloths at the market since 2007. She stocks up in Lomé and is seeking a second loan through WAGES in order to buy more colorful West African cloths. 

She would like to expand her business by opening a shop and provide for its needs.

loans.use: to buy colorful West African cloths

loans.name: Fassoun

texts.fr:
Monsieur  FASSOUN  est âgé de 46 ans et vit avec ses 6 enfants et ses épouses dans une famille traditionnelle à FARABA, un des villages de la sous préfecture  Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
FASSOUN n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales et autre article divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales et d’article divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de riz, 5 sacs de sucre et 2 cartons de thé, auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à FARABA, à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
FASSOUN espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fassoun is 46 years old and lives with his six children and wives in a traditional family in Faraba, one of the villages of the sub-prefecture Ouelessebougou in the Region of Koulikoro.

Fassoun did not have the opportunity to attend school.  Early on, he became interested in working, most notably in the purchase and sale of cereals and other various items.  He learned about this trade from his maternal uncle, who was an important merchant of grains and misc. articles.  Faced with the challenge of satisfying his growing clientele, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso.  

He is on his third individual loan, which will be used to buy 2 tons of rice, 5 bags of sugar, and 2 cartons of tea from the wholesalers of Bamako, which he then sells retail in Faraba both in credit and cash to a mixed clientele. 

Fassoun hopes to earn a monthly income of 100,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay back the loan, while reinvesting the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 tons of rice, 5 bags of sugar, and 2 cartons of tea.

loans.name: Katiereton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Katiereton 3 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et  Chika Zegué   debout au milieu, sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 750.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Katiereton 3 group are married men with an average age of 50. They have an average of six children each and all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, a village in Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during the winter period.

The crop grown by the group is corn. Chika Zegué, who is standing in the middle of the photo, plans to use his loan to buy soil amendments and seeds, and to pay labor expenses for work on five hectares of land.

The crops produced by the group’s members are sold in the village and at Sikasso market. Their customers are mainly resellers from the big cities. Chika Zegué hopes to make an average profit of 750,000 francs CFA per season. This profit would allow him to repay his loan, and also to help his large family with its daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy soil amendments and seeds and pay for labor expenses.

loans.name: Rabiétou

texts.fr: Rabiétou est une femme âgé(e) de 52 ans. Elle est veuve et a 03 enfants. Le premier a 30ans et le dernier 25ans.  Elle est revendeuse de céréales depuis 1980 et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle exerce seule l’activité dans un marché de la place et sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des céréales. Elle veut développer l’activité et mieux s’assurer dans le domaine santé.
texts.en:
Rabiétou is a 52-year-old woman. She is a widow and has three children. Her eldest child is 30 years old and her youngest child is 25 years old. 

She has been selling grains since 1980, and she stocks up in Lomé. She runs her business by herself in a market in town, and she is seeking her first loan through WAGES in order to buy grains. 

She wants to develop her business and better ensure her health.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Nadjegueton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe    NADJEGUETON 4 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et      Daouda 1ere   assis de la gauche vers la droite, sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The member of NADJEGUETON 4 are married men, averaging 49 years of age and six children. They all live in traditional families in Flazambougou, a village in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be successful with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. Their crops is corn.
Daouda, sitting on the left in the photograph, intends to use his part of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay labor costs to maintain 1.5 hectare of land.
After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising mostly resellers from the larger cities.
Daouda intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 185'000 (ca US$ 350) per farming cycle, to be used to repay the loan, and also support the daily expenses of his large family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.fr: Agée de 29ans et mère d’01 enfant de 02ans, Dzifa est mariée à un ingénieur. Elle est coiffeuse de profession. Pour rendre ses clients dans de bonnes conditions, elle a commencé par vendre des produits cosmétiques mèches, tissages, produits de beauté et autres dans son salon de coiffure ouvert en 2006. Elle exerce seule l’activité et est à son second crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.  Elle veut épargner les profits, élargir l’activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
29 years old and the mother of two children, Dzifa is married to an engineer.  She is a professional hairstylist.  

In order to leave her clients in a good condition, Dzifa began selling cosmetic products such as highlights, weave, beauty products, and more in her hair salon that opened in 2006.  She does business on her own, and is on her second loan through WAGES.  This loan will allow her to buy cosmetic products.  She wants to save her profits, grow her business, and provide for her family's essential needs.

loans.use: to buy highlights, weave, and beauty products.

loans.name: Nadjegueton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe    NADJEGUETON 1 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et   Nouhoum debout au milieu, sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the NADJEGUETON 1 group are married men, with an average age of 45, and an average of five children each. They all live in traditional families in Flazambougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, 3rd administrative district of Mali. 
They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be successful in their farming activities during the rainy season. 
The men grow corn. With his loan, Nouhoum (standing at center in the photo) plans to buy intrants, seeds, and to pay for tilling costs on his 2 hectares of land. 
After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village, at the Sikasso market to customers who are mostly retailers from the large towns. 
He expects to make an average profit of 200,000 CFA francs per season.
This profit will allow him to repay the loan and also to help his extended family meet their everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy intrants, seeds and to pay for tilling costs.

loans.name: Nadjegueton 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADJEGUETON 5 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et  Mahamadou  1ere  de la gauche vers la droite, sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group NADJEGUETON 5 are married men who average 47 years of age and five children. They all live in traditional families in Flazambougou, a village of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in an attempt to better organize their farming activities during the rainy season. They grow maize, and Mahamadou, first from the left in the photo, plans to use his loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the the cost of ploughing one hectare of land.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village at the market of Sikasso to a clientele consisting mainly of resellers from the big cities. 

Mahamadou expects to earn an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per season. This revenue will allow him to repay his loan and to help the family with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and pay for ploughing.

loans.name: Yoadi

texts.fr:
Née 1957  à TOMINIAN, YOADI vit avec ses 4 enfants dans sa  famille dans le quartier BELE de la ville de SANANKOROBA. 
Enseignante de profession,  YOADI s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance du BURKINA FASO et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les trois prêts précédents, YOADI est à son quatrième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de SANANKOROBA et dans les structures professionnelles de la place, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
YOADI espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Tominian, Yoadi lives with her four children and family in the Bele neighbourhood of the city of Sanankoroba.

A teacher by profession, Yoadi became interested in generating income primarily through the purchase and sale of outfits mostly from Burkina Faso, as well as Wax [a brand] pagnes from Lomé (in Togo).

After having properly repaid her three previous loans, Yoadi is on her fourth loan through Soro Yiriwaso, which she will use to purchase 100 articles of Wax pagnes from wholesalers.  She sells retail from home, the market in Sanankoroba, and in the professional buildings locally to a clientele of men and women.  She handles her sales in cash and credit.

Yoadi would like to earn a monthly income of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used for family needs, loan repayments, and as reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes.

loans.name: Katiereton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Katiereton 1sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et Adama debout au milieu, sur la photo, 
 compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 4 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 600.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Katiereton 1 group are married men who average 51 years of age and 6 children each.  They all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, a village in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to bring their farming activities to a successful conclusion during the rainy season.  The crop that they are growing is maize.

Standing at the center, in the photo, Adama is planning to use his loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and also to pay for the cost of plowing on a 4-hectare land.

Production is sold at the village level, and, after the harvest, at the Sikasso market to a customer base which mostly consists of resellers from the big cities.

Adama is expecting average profits to reach 600,000 CFA francs per season. Profits will help him to repay his loan and to take care of his large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Nadjegueton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe    NADJEGUETON 2 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et    Ousmane  debout au milieu, sur la photo,  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 3,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 450.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The member of NADJEGUETON 2 are married men, averaging 50 years of age and six children. They all live in traditional families in Flazambougou, a village in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be successful with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. Their crops is corn.

Ousmane, standing in the middle in the photograph, intends to use his part of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay labor costs to maintain 3.5 hectares of land.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising mostly resellers from the larger cities. 

Ousmane intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 450'000 (ca US$ 850) per farming cycle, to be used to repay the loan, and also support the daily expenses of his large family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay labor costs

loans.name: Némé

texts.fr: Némé est âgée de 49ans. Elle est mère de 02 enfants âgés de 25 et 22ans. Ils vont tous à l’école. Il a commencé en 1996 par vendre des sacs de charbons de bois à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les localités du pays. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut assurer la prospérité de son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Némé is a 49-year-old woman. She is the mother of two children who are 25 and 22 years old. Both children attend school. 

She began selling bags of charcoal from her home in 1996, and she stocks up in Lomé and in other towns in the country. 

This is her second loan through WAGES and she is seeking this loan to buy more goods. She wants to ensure the prosperity of her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 42 years old. She is married and lives in New Kru along with her three children. They are between 15 to 25 years old and are in school. She is a high school graduate. She used the money that she generated from her graduation program to establish her business. For six years, she has been managing her small income from her shop that sells rice, soft drinks, and water by wholesale. Mamie says nothings makes her happy like her business. She is an honorable woman, because her business has gained her popularity, respect, and trust. Most especially, she has a very happy home. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice, soft drinks, and water to meet her customer's needs. Her plan is to expand her business and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soft drinks, and water to meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Thong

texts.en:
Thong is 36 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Thong has been selling fruit for more than seven years and earns approximately $13 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $3 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s financial situation, Thong is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fruit for resale.   The loan would allow her to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en: Narin, 51, is widowed and resides with her brother and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a taxi service (motor taxi) for more than four years, earning approximately $5 per day. Additionally, she grows mushrooms to sell and earns about $11 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Narin is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to breed and resale when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her mushroom farm and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resale when they gain weight.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron is 31 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia; her children are still in her care. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years and earns approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $3 per day.  

Saron wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Saron is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timbers to cover the walls in her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a small restaurant to earn more income for the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to cover the walls in her house.

loans.name: Yern

texts.en:
Yern is 59 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one daughter in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $14 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. Her daughter is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s financial situation, Yern is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more groceries for resale. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Imalika Group

texts.en:
Abdalla, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children who go to school. He has been running a café (which sells juice, water, sodas, mandanzi, chapati, cakes and bagiya) for five years now. He works from 5:00 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle, to restock items, to start building his house, and for household expenses, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more items for the café to sell. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Imalika, which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more items for the café to sell.

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en: Chamreoun, 44, is the father of five children and resides with his wife in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been employed in a construction company, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife is a tailor who earns about $4 per day. Two of their children are employed. They earn about $7 per day. Chamreoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a plot of land next to his house to expand his property. In the future, he would like to expand his wife’s tailoring shop and help his children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land next to his house to expand his property.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in New Kru. She is 35 years old and married. She has three children between the ages of six and 14, and they are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in the 9th grade, but she has other skills like business management. For the past seven years, she has been running a shop where she sells lappets (traditional clothing).

She started this business with a little income from her husband and learned this way of selling from her parents. She says she enjoys her business, because it has given her pride, and she really enjoys the interaction between her and her customers. A problem she is facing is meeting the needs of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappets (traditional clothing) to expand her business. Her plan is to expand her business and become an international investor.

loans.use: To purchase more lappets (traditional clothing) to expand her business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is 47 years old. She is the mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for more than twenty years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. She earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying ice cream for resale. He earns about $5 per day. All of her children are employed. They earn about $12 per day. 

Oun wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Oun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timber to build her house. This money will help her get a new house and provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business to earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build her house

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio used a previous loan to buy school uniforms. With the profits, he was able to diversify his business and he now sells other clothes besides uniforms. He faces hardships of inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and his personal goal is educating his children. With the loan, Zaverio intends to buy clothes and uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and other clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is 58 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years and earns approximately $2 per day. She is also a chef and earns about an additional $5 per day in this occupation. Her husband is a disabled person. Her children are employed in a garment factory and earn about $5 per day. 

In order to improve her agricultural business operations, Yan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce her cultivation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda is 33 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling dessert for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $5 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Chenda is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house in the next two years.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Mech

texts.en:
Mech is 32 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia; her children are still in her care. She has been running a pub for more than two years and earns approximately $33 per day. Her husband is employed in the Ministry of Public Works and Transport and earns about $5 per day.  

In order to improve her business, Mech is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase utensils to use in her pub’s kitchen. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchsae utensils to use in her pub's kitchen.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a forty-nine-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been selling milk for fourteen years. His hardships are seasonal weather variations that affect milk production, price fluctuation, and lack of good preserving equipment. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to diversify his business to include farming. 

Mario wants the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Zedekiah

texts.en:
Zedekiah, 46, is a married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has farmed cotton for twenty years and is the major distributor in the region. Seasonal variations in the weather are his challenge.

Zedekiah is applying for a 700,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to pay workers to maintain his cotton field. He has two goals: to build a cotton processing plant and educate his children.

loans.use: to maintain his cotton field.

loans.name: Muhokya Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail business for twelve years; she started with 50,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. Her challenge is customers who do not pay on time.  Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. 

Mary requests a loan to buy sugar and salt for resale. She is a member of the Muhokya Twekambe Group; five out of the seven members are requesting the loan but as a group policy each member guarantees the others in accessing the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Imamu

texts.en: Imamu is a 30-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children. He has been trading in cattle for the last six years, despite hardships of inadequate capital to purchase enough cows to meet the high demand. He has a vision of moving his business to new areas and setting up a ranch. Imamu needs a loan to buy cows for resale.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine lives in Meghri town with her husband, Davit, and son, Artur. She is 23. About a year ago the young couple started running a farm, where they raise cattle. Lusine and her husband manage the farm successfully, and now want to develop it. Lusine has applied for this loan to get sufficient funds to purchase 2 cows. This will allow Lusine to continue increasing the number of cattle, make her farm more profitable and secure a stable future for her child.

loans.use: to pay for cattle

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is 50 years old. She lives in Arevshat village with her husband and son. Sonya's son is 26. He works at the local school. Sonya's husband is 53, and is involved in agriculture with his wife. They run a farm, where they grow peach trees, tomatoes, and keep hens. 

Sonya has applied for this loan, as she needs sufficient funds to develop her farm. With the loan's help she will purchase tomato seeds, medicine, fertilizer, chickens and food for hens. Sonya expects an increase of income from the sales of her harvest, eggs and chicken meat. This is important for Sonya to create better conditions in her household and insure a brighter future for her son's future family.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, medicine, fertilizer, chickens and food for hens

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Garni village with her husband and school age son. For already 10 years Anna has run an orchard, where she grows different types of fruit trees. Each year she gathers the harvest and sells to the wholesale and local market traders.

Anna plans to improve conditions in her orchard by building a fence. She is asking for this loan to purchase the necessary construction materials for the fence. This is important for Anna to protect the orchard and create more favorable conditions for the trees.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials to build a fence for her orchard

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 31 years old. She is a mother of one child and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is involved in raising poultry and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokha is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase poultry and cattle for resale. By doing so, she would generate more profit to support the family. In the future, Sokha would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Soksan Neary

texts.en: Soksan Neary is 29 years old. She is single and resides with her brother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a beauty salon for more than two years, earning approximately $7 per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Soksan Neary is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her brother to run a taxi service (motor taxi). This purchase would enable her brother to earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to earn more profit to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her brother to run a taxi service

loans.name: Dara

texts.en: Dara is 32 years old. He is a father of three children and resides with his wife in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction foreman for more than five years, earning approximately $4 per day. His wife is involved in sewing monk’s bags to sell and earns about $2 per day. All of his children are still in his care and in school. Dara wants to rebuild his present house. With this goal in mind, Dara is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase construction materials to rebuild his house. By doing so, he would provide better living condition for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild his house

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is 30 years old and a father who has one infant child. He is raising his family in a village, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for sale. He aimed to improve his farming business to earn a sufficient income for his family. He dreamed of becoming financially stable so that he can educate his child and give his family a better life. 

For this reason, he planned to plant more squash and beans for sale but due to inadequate capital, he is requesting an additional PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. He believes that his loan will enable him to work out his plan and hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 59 years old. She is a mother of seven children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than twenty years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. 

Ny is involved in growing rice and fattening animals. She earns approximately $7 per day. Ny's husband helps her run the business. Five of her children are employed. They earn about $22 per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Ny is requesting a loan of $1100 to pay for her child's wedding expenses. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine lives in Ginevet village. She is 26. Arpine works at the local village hall as a secretary. Arpine lives with her brother and parents. The family runs a farm, where they grow different types of fruits and vegetables and sell to local traders. 

Arpine has applied for this loan to develop the orchard. She plans to purchase young trees, as well as fertilizer and medicine to help grow trees. This is important for Arpine to gather a good harvest, sell it, and have a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for young trees, fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy is 68 years old. He is married and resides with his wife and a son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction foreman for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. His wife sells dessert and earns about $2 per day. His son is employed in a garment factory. He earns about $4 per day. Suy wants to rebuild his house. Due to lack of funds, Suy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild his house. By doing so, he would be able to provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business in order to earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild his house

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 26 years old and newly married. They live in a rural community, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. He has been a farmer for almost five years earning a profit of PHP 9,000 a month. He utilized his income for their daily consumption and other expenses at home.  His goal is to earn a higher income to build their own house and save for their future. Despite financial difficulty, he has the determination to improve their status of living. He planned to expand his vegetable production to ensure higher production. He is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will be able to make an improvement in his farming business. He hopes that someday, he will become financially stable as he continues to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo is 55 years old. She is the mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs the rice grinding service. He earns about $2 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $5 per day. Keo is requesting a loan of $500 to pay for her child’s wedding ceremony expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding ceremony expenses

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 05ans qui va à l’école.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de bazins et de produits cosmétiques depuis 2009. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et exerce l’activité  dans une boutique. Sa difficulté est la mévente. 
Akossiwa a requis son secondt crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins.
Dans les prochaines années, Akossiwa voudrait aller s’approvisionner à l’extérieur (CHINE et autres) et contribuer au bien-être de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 33-year-old woman. She is married to a shopkeeper. She has one 5-year-old child who is in school.

Akossiwa has been selling damasks and cosmetic products since 2009. She stocks up in Lomé and sells her goods in a shop. The biggest difficulty she faces is poor sales.

Akossiwa has sought a second loan through WAGES in order to buy more damasks.

In the coming years, Akossiwa would like to begin stocking up in foreign countries (China, etc.) and contribute to the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and damasks

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Noy is 63 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. Noy is requesting a loan of $500 to pay for her child’s wedding ceremony expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding ceremony expenses

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 31-year-old single young man. He is employed, but the salary he gets isn't enough to cover all his daily needs.

To improve his income, Mohammad opened a store to sell shoes five years ago. It is located in a good movement area and is distinguished from others in selling shoes of high quality. This makes Mohammad's project a profitable one, but he also needs more support to continue and cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of summer shoes. This loan will offer to Mohammad a wide new collection of summer shoes, so he can compete with others and satisfy his customers. This will lead to increased sales and improve Mohammad's income.

Mohammad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of summer shoes to sell

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr:
Latifa est une femme âgé(e) de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un professeur. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a moins de 03ans  ans et le dernier a moins de 01an.
Latifa travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes et bazins depuis 2007. Elle vend de façon ambulant et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté est le fait de se promener pour livrer ses marchandises.
Latifa a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et des bazins. Elle veut agrandir son stock.
Dans les prochaines années, Latifa voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Latifa is a 38 year old woman.She is married to a teacher.She has 02 children of which one goes to school.The first is less than 3 years old and the last under a year old.
Latifa has worked as a dress and textile retailer since 2007.She sells on an itinerant basis and buys her stock at Lomé.Her main difficulty is having to walk about to sell her merchandise.
Latifa requests her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase fabric.She wants to increase her stock.
