Over the next few years,Latifa would like to open a shop.She says that with the profits,she hopes to provide for the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and rolls of fabric

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Kossivi est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est célibataire et a un enfant.  
Kossivi travaille comme chauffeur dans une société de la place et est en même temps revendeur de liqueurs depuis 2009. Il exerce l’activité à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Kossivi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des liqueurs. Il veut renforcer l’activité et assurer la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Kossivi is a 32 year old man. He is single and has one child. Kossivi works as a driver with a local company, and at the same time has been selling liquor since 2009. He does this from home and buys his stock in Lomé.
Kossivi needs this first loan from WAGES in order to purchase liquor. He wants to grow his business and to ensure his child's education.

loans.use: to purchase liquor

loans.name: Badassawé

texts.fr:
Badassawé est une femme  âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un  transporteur. Elle a 02 enfants. Le premier a 03 ans et le dernier a 01 an.  
Badassawé travaille comme couturière et revendeuse d’articles de mercerie depuis 2003. Elle exerce l’activité dans un atelier et est aidée par 03 apprentis.
Badassawé a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Badassawé voudrait devenir grossiste et voudrait aider son mari dans l’épanouissement de sa modeste famille.
texts.en:
Badassawé is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a haulage contractor. She has two children. Her eldest child is three years old and her youngest child is one year old. Badassawé has been selling haberdashery products and working as a couturier since 2003. She works in a workshop and is assisted by three apprentices.

Badassawé has sought a third loan through WAGES in order to buy haberdashery products. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Badassawé would like to become a wholesaler and help her husband in ensuring the development of her modest family.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery products

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
Maksim lives in Yerevan with his wife and two children. Six years ago Maksim started his business trading in food and vegetables. Due to his entrepreneurial skills, Maksim expanded his business and now runs two shops. Maksim's wife helps him with the business while operating the household. 

Maksim wants to continue developing his business and wants to get involved in a new line of work; bread production. He plans to establish a bakery, for which he needs an investment to purchase the necessary equipment. With the loan's help Maksim will purchase an oven, vent tubes, and dishes. This loan is important for Maksim to start a new business and create conditions for its further development.

loans.use: to pay for an oven, vent tubes, and dishes

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 28. He lives in Artashat town with his wife and children. Five years ago this young entrepreneur started his business of trading in mobile phones and phone accessories. Gevorg chose this type of business, as mobile phones are in big demand in the city, and its continually increasing. 

Gevorg would like to purchase more phones and accessories, as a larger stock with more variety will help him to stay competitive and increase sales. 

Gevorg has future plans to open a new shop when he is financially able to afford the investments. Current development of business is important for Gevorg to implement this goal.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Agbégnidor

texts.fr: Agbégnidor est un jeune de 38ans. Il a en charge 03 personnes (sa femme qui est gérante d’un pressing et ses 02 enfants  qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 10ans et le dernier 08ans. Il est commercial de profession et a en même temps une boutique de quincaillerie. Il a commencé l'activité en 1997. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé et il est à son second crédit de WAGES pour acheter des articles de la quincaillerie. Il veut augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Agbégnidor is a 38-year-old man. He has three people living in his care (his wife, who is a manager at a dry-cleaner's, and his two children, who both attend school). His eldest child is 10 years old and his youngest child is 8 years old. 

He is a marketing rep, and he also runs a hardware shop on the side. He started his hardware business in 1997. He stocks up in Lomé and is seeking his second loan through WAGES in order to buy hardware. 

He wants to increase his sales and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy hardware

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Emelia engages in making and selling peanut butter and tomato sauce to help her husband in financing the education of their two children who are now in tertiary education. They want them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. She aimed to produce more peanut butter to sell in the market and to their community but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fresh peanuts, tomatoes, seasonings and materials needed in making peanut butter and tomato sauce to sell. She believes that the loan will enable her to make an improvement in her business and hopes that she will make her business grow and be profitable in order to support her family and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy fresh peanuts, tomatoes, seasonings and materials needed in making peanut butter and tomato sauce to sell

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe lives in Goris town with his family; his wife, two children and his parents. A few years ago this 36-year-old farmer started his business. At the beginning his farm included 30 hens. Through years due to his hard work Vahe managed to increase the number of hens to 150. Vahe also keeps fish. 

Vahe would like to develop his farm, for which he has applied for this loan. With the requested amount he plans to purchase hens and food for them. 

With the development of agriculture Vahe will earn more income, which is vital for him to meet his family's needs and create more prosperous conditions for them.

loans.use: to pay for hens and forage

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, Noemi engages in selling AVON and Ever Belena products in her community to generate additional income. She and her husband aim to upgrade their living status and to educate their children and give them a bright future. Despite the problems and difficulties they have encountered in life, Noemi has the confidence and determination to pursue and improve her business. 

Noemi is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of AVON and Ever Belena products to sell in her community. She believes that the loan will enable her to make improvements to her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of AVON and Ever Belena products to sell.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel is 34 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife operates a spare parts trading business for cell phones. She started this business at the end of 2011. Altangerel started his motorcycle parts shop and repair service business in 2007 by renting a counter in a market. Ever since he started his business, he has successfully become an official distributor for major companies. Therefore, his income is stable and he has become known to many customers. However, his resources aren't sufficient to supply the customers. He's a sharp and hardworking man and he's requesting 3,800,000 MNT to purchase more supplies for his motorcycle parts shop and for his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for his motorcycle parts shop and for his wife's business

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is 51 years old. She is the mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. She earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a veterinarian who earns about $8 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Hong is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase farmland to use for growing rice. This purchase would enable her to expand her business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a pig farm and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and has two school-age children. They live in a village, plant rice and vegetables, and raise livestock to sell. Anita and her husband aim to become financially stable so that they will be able to support the education of their children and improve their poor living conditions. They have been farmers for almost twenty-five years, earning a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP that they usually spend on food, clothing, and allowances for their children. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Anita aims to raise more pigs to sell. She is asking for an additional capital of 12,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She hopes to someday improve her business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Nasser appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured sewing clothes.

Mervat is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to Nasser and is a mother to three sons and two daughters. For the past ten years, she and her husband have been running a clothes sewing business. It is a successful project and the only source of income for the family, but it also needs more support in order to cover the costs and the family's needs.

Mervat is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD from FATEN to help her and her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new sewing machine and ironing tools. This will increase their workload and improve the quality of their sewing so that their sales will increase and their family's income will improve.

loans.use: to improve her sewing business and purchase a sewing machine and ironing tools.

loans.name: Sung

texts.en:
Sung is 37 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $5 per day. Sung's husband runs the business of purchasing cattle to resell. He earns about $10 per day. Two of Sung's children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $7 per day. 

In order to improve her family's finances, Sung is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase farmland to use for her agricultural crops cultivation. This purchase would help her expand her business and earn more income to support her family. In the future, Sung would like to run an additional business to earn more income for her family and help her children earn a higher education to get a good job.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for her agricultural crops cultivation.

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerelmaa is 41 years old and lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her elder daughter just finished college and helps Gerelmaa with her business, while her younger one attends a local secondary school. Gerelmaa started her wallpaper retail business in 2007 by renting a counter in a construction market. 

Before starting the business, Gerelmaa was a clerk in the same field, and she is therefore highly experienced. Now that the warm season is approaching, construction work will begin, and she therefore has to save enough supplies to run her business efficiently. 

Gerelmaa is a sharp and hardworking woman. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more wallpaper for her business, because her business operates in the market in the summertime.

loans.use: to purchase more wall coverings.

loans.name: Fatoumatou

texts.fr: Fatoumatou est une dame qui est âgée de 44ans. Pour aider son mari(menuisier) dans les charges du foyer et assurer l’épanouissement de ses 05 enfants, elle a commencé par vendre les produits de détails(charbon de bois, maïs, igname et les produits de premières nécessités) Elle exerce seule l’activité à la maison et sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, assurer sa prospérité et voir sa famille encore mieux s’épanouir. Elle a démarré l’activité en 1987. Deux de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Le premier a 23ans et le dernier 05ans.
texts.en: Fatoumatou is a 44-year-old woman. In order to support her husband, a carpenter, with the household expenses and to ensure that her 5 children flourish, she sells retail products (firewood, yams and staple products). She works at home, alone, and is requesting this first loan from WAGES in order to restock her merchandise; she would like to reinvest in her business, ensure her prosperity and watch her family flourish further. She started her business in 1987. Two of her 5 children, aged between 5 and 23, go to school.

loans.use: to buy firewood, yams and groceries.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her family helps with her business. She started her sewing business in 2009. Before she started the business, she used to work in a sewing factory, therefore, her sewing skills are excellent. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "To open my own business was the best decision of my life and if I could work a little harder, I would be able to send my son to college". She's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase additional sewing machines and upgrade current equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional sewing machines and upgrade current equipment

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  Diata 2ème assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 40, an average of 3 children and who all live in polygamous families in Zerlaba, a village in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan from the institution, the previous loans having all been correctly repaid.

Diata, sitting second from the left in the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy the agricultural inputs and seeds she needs to maintain 1 hectare of farmland. She sells her harvested produce in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 150 000 francs per crop cycle. The profits will allow her to repay her loan and support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Agée de 39ans et mère de 04ans, Abra est revendeuse de maïs et produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1998. Son conjoint est technicien bâtiment. Son premier enfant est âgé de 16ans et le dernier 08ans. Ils vont tous à l’école. Elle exerce l’activité à domicile à toutes personnes et fait ses achats à Lomé. Sa difficulté est la mévente. Elle sollicite ce second crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité , assurer sa prospérité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
39 years old and the mother of 4 children, Abra has been a retailer of corn and general groceries since 1998. Her partner is a building technician. Her eldest child is 16 and the youngest 8 years old. They all attend school. 
She conducts her business from home, with a wide variety of customers, and buys her stock in Lomé. Her problem is the slump. 
She is seeking this second loan with WAGES in order to buy more stock. She wants to invest in the business, to ensure her prosperity and the development of her family.

loans.use: to purchase general groceries and corn.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  Kary assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 40, an average of 3 children and who all live in polygamous families in Zerlaba, a village in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan from the institution; the previous loans have all been correctly repaid.

Kary, sitting in the middle of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy the agricultural inputs and seeds she needs to maintain her 1 hectare of farmland. She sells her harvested produce in her village and at the Sikasso market to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 150 000 francs per growth cycle. The profits will allow her to repay her loan and support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Abrouwa

texts.fr:
Abrouwa est une femme âgé(e) de 38ans. Elle est mariée à un policier et a 02 enfants âgés de 18 et 15ans. Un seul est scolarisé. Elle est revendeuse de charbon de bois et du soja à domicile depuis 1997. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Abrouwa a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon de bois et du soja. Elle veut épargner les profits, agrandir l’activité et assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Abrouwa is a 38 year old woman. She is married to a policeman and has 2 children aged 18 and 15. One of them is in school. She has been a door-to-door seller of charcoal and soya since 1997. She buys her stock in Lomé.
Abrouwa needs this second loan with WAGES in order to buy bags of charcoal and soya. She wants to save her profits, grow her business and cover the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and soya.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is 28 years old. He lives in Yeravan city. A few years ago Edvard decided to leave his hometown in the Lori region, North Armenia, and arrived in Yerevan, where he could have better life opportunities. Edvard started his own business by opening an employment agency. Operating the business successfully, Edvard had stable income and made savings to start a new business and open a cafe. He had already purchased crockery and a cooking battery. Edvard needs more funds to continue investing in the business. With the help of this loan he wants to purchase furniture and equipment for the kitchen. 
This loan will help Edvard to finish all the work with the cafe and open it soon. Edvard is full with enthusiasm with his new business and hopes it will bring him more income, with the help of which he will be able to purchase his own house.

loans.use: to pay for furniture and equipment for the kitchen

loans.name: Oyundulam

texts.en: Oyundulam is 34 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. She started her fruit retailing business in 2002 by renting a counter in the market. Since she started the business, she has expanded her counter and gained many regular customers. Now that summer is approaching, she needs to increase her supplies in order to meet the market demand. In the future she planning to build her own house. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "Since my business is the only income in the family, I need to make the best of it". She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more varieties of fruit in order to increase her working capital. .

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of fruit in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  Nasseta Clakayere assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 130.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of BENKADI 3 Group are married women who average 42 years of age and four children. They all live in polygamous families in ZERLABA,  a village in SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be successful with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their eighth loan from Soro Yiriwaso. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

Nasseta Clakayere, sitting in the center in the photograph, grows peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds to maintain 1 hectare of land.

After the harvest, the production gets sold in the village and at the market in SIKASSO, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

Nasseta Clakayere intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 130'000 (ca US$ 240) per farming cycle, to be used to repay the loan and help her husband take care of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr:
Essohanam est une femme âgé(e) de 29ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 03ans qui va à l’école.
Essohanam travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux, foulards, habits et pagnes  depuis 2006. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et exerce seule son activité de façon ambulante. Sa difficulté est le fait de se promener pour servir ses nombreux clients.
Essohanam a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes, des foulards et bijoux.. Elle veut agrandir l’activité en ayant un lieu fixe pour s’installer et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Essohanam is a 29 year old woman. She is married to a welder. She has one 3 year old child who attends school. Essohanam has worked as a seller of jewelry, scarves, outfits and traditional cloths since 2006. She buys her stock in Lomé and works alone on a mobile basis. Her problem is having to walk about in order to deal with her large customer base. 
Essohanam is seeking this second loan from WAGES in order to buy traditional cloths, scarves and jewelry.. She wants to grow her business by having a fixed place to trade from, and to assure her children's future.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, scarves and traditional cloth.

loans.name: Ochir

texts.en: Ochir is 35 years old and lives with his parents in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. He started his taxi driving business in early 2011. Since then his income has increased and he has improved his car. Even though he is fairly new to the business, he knows the routes very well and he has 15 years of driving experience. However, his car has been seriously damaged and it is unable to run. Since he's the only provider in the family, he can't afford to lose his business. He's requesting 1,800,000 MNT to buy a motor and a window for his car.

loans.use: To buy a motor and a window for his car

loans.name: Shiilegtumur

texts.en: Shiilegtumur is 49 years old and lives with her three daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away recently, her eldest daughter is unemployed and her younger two are college students. She started her goods-trading business in 1998. She buys Mongolian goods and sells them to Russia. Mostly these are clothes and household goods. Over the years, she has gained many trusted suppliers and buyers. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "Since my husband passed away, it has been hard to support my children especially the ones in college. But I have to work harder. I won't let my children down". She's requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more goods in order to increase her trading capacity.

loans.use: To purchase more goods in order to increase her trading capacity

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en: Hovhannes lives in Haykavan village with his wife and children. He is involved in agriculture. Hovhannes's wife operates the household and helps him with the farm to keep the orchard and breed cattle. Hovhannes would like to develop his cattle breeding, for which he needs sufficient means. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 2 little bulls. This is important for reproduction of the cattle, which will allow Hovhannes to gather more income from his farm and to be financially able to renovate the barn. Additional income will also be used for renovation of Hovhannes's house, which means better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 2 bulls

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec Flamousso Alassane, première assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women who are on average 40 years old with three children, all living in polygamous families in Zerlaba, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution, and past loans have been repaid.

Flamousso Alassane grows peanuts, and is the first sitting at right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds to cultivate 1 hectare (approximately 2.5 acres). After harvest, the crop is sold at village level and at the Sikasso market, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per crop. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Beatric Toe.

texts.en: Beatrice Toe is 40 years old and lives in the New Kur Town area. She’s married with 4 children aged 6 to 18, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past 5 years she has been involved in the sale of clothes, lappas (a traditional West African cloth), slippers, and artificial hair. Beatrice has requested this loan to purchase more clothes, lappas, slippers, and artificial hair in order to expand her business into a larger one. The problem she’s faced with is the changing of USD to Liberian dollars. She started this business by selling cool water in a wheel barrow, which she learnt from friends. What she likes about this business is that she makes new friends and meets people each and every day. Her business makes her proud of having money in her handbag every day. In the future she wants to open another shop in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, lappas, slippers, and artificial hair in order to expand her business

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Zerlaba, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   Balakissa Arouna  3ème debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi A group are married women who on average are 38 years old with two children, all living in polygamous families in Zerlaba, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Balakissa Arouna grows peanuts, and is the third standing from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds, and pay labor costs to cultivate 1 hectare (approximately 2.5 acres).

After harvest, the crop is sold at village level and at the Sikasso market, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 110,000 FCFA per crop. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for labor, agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali.

La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  Fatoumatou Kleno debout au milieu sur la photo.

She expects to make an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per crop. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is 49 years old. She lives in Hovtashen village with her family: husband, son, daughter-in-law and 2 little grandchildren. While Anahit's son, Karen, works at the local police station, Anahit and her husband are involved in farming. They cultivate land, keep an orchard where they grow apricot trees, and keep 2 greenhouses. In order to start spring sowing, Anahit has applied for this loan, which she plans to use for purchasing watermelon seeds, fertilizer and medicine. Anahit expects to gather a rich harvest, which she will sell to the wholesale and local market traders. This means additional income for Anahit, which is important for her to meet the family's needs during the year.

loans.use: to pay for watermelon seeds, fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  Abi, première assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

After harvest, the crop is sold at village level and at the Sikasso market, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 160,000 FCFA per crop. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi D Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI D sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Zerlaba, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec     Binta Bocary,  2ème assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi D group are married women who on average are 41 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Zerlaba, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Binta Bocary grows peanuts, and is the second person sitting from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds, and pay for labor to cultivate 1 hectare (approximately 2.5 acres).

After harvest, the crop is sold at village level and at the Sikasso market, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 85,000 FCFA per crop. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for labor, agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a thirty-eight-year-old married man. He has four children whose ages range from two to fourteen. He describes himself as a quiet and honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, wheat flour, salt, sodas, maize flour etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a commercial town and his primary customers are local residents.

In addition to this business, he also runs a carpentry workshop. He describes his biggest business challenge as low bargaining power from the customer. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy some timber for the construction of his retail store business premises. 

Previously, Isaac had taken a loan of KES 20,000 which he managed to pay back well. His business goal is to have permanent business premises. He hopes that in the future, he will pay for his children school fees.

loans.use: to buy some timber to construct his retail business premise.

loans.name: Alpha's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you these gentlemen. They are staff of a reputable company located in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. These guys have come to SMT to request a loan for various reasons. Some will use it to buy house-building materials, others will use theirs to invest in business, some to pay school fees for their children, etc. At the end of each month, their company’s finance officer will deduct the amount they owe SMT/Kiva and repay on their behalf.

Alpha is their leader. He is a native of Mahama village, in northern Sierra Leone. The forty-year-old is married to a farmer and they have four children who are attending primary school. Alpha has been working for this company for nine years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like cement, steel doors, steel windows, glass, tiles, etc. for the completion of the house he has started building. This will be the fourth loan that Alpha has accessed from SMT. With the help of previous loans, he started the construction of a house for his family. And with this loan, he will complete the building process, thanks to loans he receives from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement, steel doors, steel windows, glass, tiles, etc. for the completion of the house he has started building

loans.name: Kim Leng

texts.en:
Kim Leng is 59 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than ten years.  She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. She earns approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $26 per day.

In order to be more comfortable and safe, Kim Leng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase bricks and cement to build a fence around her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and cement to build fence around her house

loans.name: Benkadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Zerlaba, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec    Wary Yacouba 3ème debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi B group are married women who on average are 37 years old with two children, all living in polygamous families in Zerlaba, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Wary Yacouba grows peanuts, and is the third standing from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds, and pay for labor to cultivate 1 hectare (approximately 2.5 acres).

After harvest, the crop is sold at village level and at the Sikasso market, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per crop. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for labor, agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Idrissa S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you these gentlemen, staff of a very reputable company in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. This group of colleagues have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva based in Makeni city, to apply for a loan. With the help of these loans, they will be able to do or invest in things that their salaries alone cannot let them do or invest in. For example, some will be able to buy pieces of household furniture or house-building materials, pay school fees for their children, invest in agriculture or in business etc. At the end of each month, their company’s financial officer will repay the loan on their behalf. 

Idrissa is the leader of this team. The 42-year-old is a native of Magburaka. He is married to a businesswoman, and they have two children who are attending secondary school. Idrissa has requested this loan in order to invest it in his business. He sells rice, sugar, and other products of that nature. He will use his share of the loan to buy rice, sugar, etc. in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, etc. in bulk to add to his business

loans.name: Malap I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Malap I” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses both in size and quality. 

The leader of this group is Adama who is pictured on the right. Adama is age thirty-eight. She used to live in Makambo village, near Makeni. Currently, she is residing in Makeni, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman too and her children are attending primary and secondary school. For many years now, Adama has been selling cooked rice and sauce. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm-oil, pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc. in bulk in order to produce a larger quantity of cooked rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm-oil, pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc. in bulk in order to produce a larger quantity of cooked rice and sauce for sale

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe Siguidia habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente des habits, de tasses, de pommes de terre, de fruits et légumes, de la fabrication  et vente de l’encens et des céréales. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ere  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata, assise au milieu, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 douzaines de tasses. Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Sikasso, auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes en ambulant et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
Predominantly married in traditional families with an average age of 40 and five children, the seven women in the Siguidia group all live in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through family ties, as neighbors and through their professional activities.

They sell clothes, mugs, potatoes, fruits and vegetables, grain cereals and manufacture incense for sale. In order to increase their working capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first credit loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata, sitting in the middle, plans to use her loan to purchase two dozen mugs. She buys locally from Sikasso wholesalers and conducts her sales as an itinerant vendor and from home, to both men and women customers.

Mrs. Fatoumata expects this loan will enable her to achieve average monthly profits of 20,000 FCFA, to be reinvested in the business and to take on some of the household needs.

loans.use: buy mugs

loans.name: Sok Ly

texts.en:
Sok Ly is 28 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in a garment factory as well. He earns about $4 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finance, Sok Ly is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to breed in order to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed in order to resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you these gentlemen. They are staff of a reputable company located in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. These guys have come to SMT to request a loan for various reasons. Some will use it to buy house-building materials, others will use theirs to invest in business, some to pay school fees for their children and so on. At the end of each month, their company’s finance officer will deduct the amount they owe SMT/Kiva and repay on their behalf.

Samuel is their leader. He is a native of Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. The forty-three-year-old is married to a trader and they have five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Samuel has requested this loan in order to invest it in his business. He will use the funds to buy alcohol (a local brew called sas) etc. to add to his business. 

This is not the first loan that Samuel has received from SMT. Samuel used his first SMT/Kiva loan to marry, he invested the second in business and he is again investing this one in his business. He describes SMT/Kiva lender loans as very helpful.

loans.use: to buy alcohol (a local brew called sas) etc. to add to his business

loans.name: Benkadi C Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Zerlaba, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  Nantene  2ème assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi C group are married women who on average are 37 years old with two children, all living in polygamous families in Zerlaba, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Nantene grows peanuts, and is the second person sitting from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds, and pay for labor to cultivate 1 hectare (approximately 2.5 acres).

After harvest, the crop is sold at village level and at the Sikasso market, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 85,000 FCFA per crop. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for labor, agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Prince D.

texts.en: Prince is 33 years old and live in New Kru Town. He is married and a high school graduate. His wife is a businesswoman and they have four children between the ages of  6 and 10, who are currently attending school. For the past five years he has been selling rice and flour by the bag in the community. He makes a lot of profit since he is the only one who is involved in that business in his community. One of the problems he is facing is that he has less income. He is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and flour to add to his business. He plans to build a house for his children in years to come, and also to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and flour to add to his business

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en: Mendbayar is 38 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two daughters in her ger (a traditional nomadic Mongolian tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband operates his own business and their two daughters go to school. In 2003 Mendbayar rented a food stall to start a business trading grocery goods. Since 2007 she has been operating a traveling business through the countryside. She travels around country side and sales grocery product. The traveling trade has more advantages, as it provides more profit and quicker income. The working capital has reached to 2,000,000 MNT. For the traveling trade, they use a car that was bought in 2011. Mendbayar and her husband are hardworking people, and their future plans are to expand their business so they can build a house. Mendbayar is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase grocery goods to serve rural people.

loans.use: To purchase grocery goods to serve rural people

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Despite the hardship of living, Rosana and her husband aim to become successful so they can educate their children and give them a better life. Rosana is 42 years old and has four school-age children. They live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they aim to increase their rice production to earn a sufficient income for the family's needs. 

To improve their farming business, Rosana is asking for P15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the expenses incurred in rice farming. She hopes that this loan will help she and her husband improve their rice farming business and enjoy high production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the expenses of rice farming

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en: Socheat is 23 years old. She is married and resides with her mother and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a pig slaughterer who earns about $6 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Socheat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase farmland to use for her rice cultivation. This money will help her expand her business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is a rice grower at Nabbotuan. He had been doing this for over ten years. He is now 36 years old, married, and has three young children. His wife works abroad. 

Marlon usually gains about PHP 20,000 each harvest season twice a year. He would like to improve his crop production so he is now asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy herbicides and fertilizers to use in farming. This will help increase his output for additional profits. 

In the future, Marlon would like to keep earning funds so that his wife will not be working abroad anymore and to be able to continuously give the best education for all his children.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a small farmer living at Nabbotuan with his wife and four grown-up children. One is still pursuing a college degree. From the farming business, he acquires about PHP 15,000 during harvest season twice a year. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to maintain good crop growth. He will buy six bags of UREA (fertilizer) and pesticides to use in farming.

Alex hopes to achieve a plentiful harvest every harvest season to save funds to use in times of emergencies, especially because he and his wife are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy six bags of UREA (fertilizer) and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Lorren

texts.en:
Lorren is 32 years old, married, and has one child. His wife is a housekeeper, while he is involved in a farming business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He usually earns about PHP 15,000 during harvest season (twice a year). 

He would like to improve his business so he is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. This will help ensure good growth of rice seedlings and increase crop production, too. 

Someday, with good profits from the business, he will establish a hog-raising business for additional income. This way the family will achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn lives at her small house at Solana with her husband, Arnold. Together they raise two children. The couple teaches them to be responsible and helpful. 

They are both involved in a farming business to earn a living. They own a hectare plot of land, where they cultivate, plant, and harvest rice. They have been in the business for over ten years now. 

Madelyn is now asking for PHP 22,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and pesticides) and pay for labor costs in farming. Madelyn and Arnold hope to achieve more productive output from the farming business. From this, they will give the best education to their children, who will soon earn degrees for the betterment of their lives someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Emelson

texts.en: Emelson is a farmer living at Nabbotuan with his wife Mercedita and three young children. The couple manages their business together. They have been planting and harvesting rice to sell for over 10 years now. They harvest twice a year for a yield of about P15,000 each harvest season. Emelson would like to keep making the business profitable for his childrens' education. He is now asking for P22,000 to buy farm supplies (fertilizers, insecticides) used in farming. Emelson prays for his family's good health and a productive yield from the farming business so he can attain a progress for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
At the age of 57, Pedro is still involved in a farming business to earn a living. He is married to Rosario, a retail store owner. They have five grown up children, and live separately from them. 

Planting and harvesting rice from a hectare rice field allows Pedro to generate about PHP 20,000 in each harvest season occurring twice a year. Income generated goes towards their meals, bills at home, and revolving capital from the farming business. Other portions of the income is also allotted for buying additional merchandise for the retail business of his wife. 

He would like to improve crop production from the farming business, so he is borrowing a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. He is paying for laborers who help him in the farm because he is not capable of doing all of the farming activities such as plowing, sowing, planting, and harvesting rice.

In the future, Pedro hopes to make their businesses profitable to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is 62 years-old, married, and has five grown up children. They were able to enter into college, but did not complete a degree due to financial problems. At his age, he still plants and harvests rice in his 1.5 hectare rice field. From this, he gives sustenance to his family. He has a supportive wife and helpful children. His children also help him manage their farming business. They work hard together for the welfare of their family. 

Now, Narciso would like to keep making the business more profitable, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 33,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for use in farming. This will help ensure good crop growth that leads to a plentiful harvest. 

Someday, he hopes to keep producing good harvest and save funds to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Generoso

texts.en:
Generoso is 59, married, and has one grown-up child. He is a farmer who has owned and managed a one-hectare rice field for almost 33 years. This is the major source of his income. 

Being a farmer, he has the desire to increase his yields to earn a sufficient income for the sake of his family. Likewise, Generoso aims to increase his yields and income to satisfy his family needs and save for their future. Due to financial difficulty, he wants to ask for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed in rice farming. 

He believes that his patience and hard work will enable him to improve his farming business and hopes that he will have high production this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed in rice farming.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a rice grower who lives in Nabbotuan with his wife and five children. Three attend school and are in need of a daily allowance. He has been in the planting and harvesting rice to sell for 10 years now. He has inherited a hectare plot of land from his parents.

Benjamin would like to ensure more productive crops for additional profits, so he is now asking for PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for land cultivation.

Benjamin's goal in life is to give the best education to their children in order for them to earn a degree and have good employment for the betterment of their lives someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 49 years old and is married with three children. Rolando is a farmer working in the Philippines, and he earned a net income of PHP 30,000 with his last cropp. Right now, Rolando is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get his requested loan so he can sustain his rice production.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizer and  rice seedlings

loans.name: Channarith

texts.en: Channarith is 29 years old. He is a father of two children and resides with his wife in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker who earns about 3 USD per day. His wife sells sweet cake and earns 6 USD per day. Due to the difficulty in his family’s transportation, Channarith is requesting a loan of 900 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable him to use the saved money on his transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand the business and help his children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en: Cayetano is 49 years old, and is married with three children. He is a farmer who has owned his rice farm for almost 20 years. He's asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He feels glad that his income from farming is enough to support his immediate family. He hopes to continue to access loans in the hope that he will be able to achieve his dreams for his family through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. They live in Baringin Sur, where he manages his one-hectare family rice field. He has been farming for 15 years. He received 25,000 PHP with his last crop. 

Right now, Emilio is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm. He hopes that he can get the amount he has requested, and he promises to repay the loan on time. He believes that this loan will be of enormous help for increasing his yield.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a single mother of five children and all her children go to school. She is also takes care of additional family members (old parents).  

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes . 
She sells clothes to all categories of people and works from her home. She works six days a week and major business challenges include thieves and transportation of bales of clothes from the Owino market in Kampala city to her home.  

She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she can sells on wholesale only and also build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and no access to electricity. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 56 years old, married and has six children. Three of them already got married while the rest are still attending school. Martin owns a hectare plot of land which he cultivates and plants rice in it. He sells the rice to traders in their village. He earns 20,000 PHP each harvest season, twice a year. Now he would like to ensure good crop growth, so he is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. 

In the future, Martin hopes to keep producing good harvest in order to gain more profits for school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en: Sarith is 27 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Additionally, she is a rice farmer. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns about $5 per day. Due to her family's transportation expenses, Sarith is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her go to work on time and reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm to earn more income to support her family and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, and beverages

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en: Somaly is 23 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than 2 years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is a truck driver who earns 5 USD per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Somaly is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase rice for resale when the price is higher. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resale

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a young entrepreneur who started her business 14 years ago. She was eager to generate her own income to contribute financially to her family. So when she learned about selling herbal soap and coffee, she started offering them to friends, neighbors, and people who live in the area.

Now with the opportunity to gain a higher income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy herbal soap, medicine, and coffee. The good quality of her products enables her to attract a large number of customers and achieve a high level of sales.

loans.use: To buy herbal soap, medicine, and coffee

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the location of the family's new house.

Sanaa is a 47-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to 4 sons and 4 daughters, their ages are between 13 and 30 years old. Some of her sons are workers and get low salaries, which is not enough to cover their needs.

Sanaa is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing additional necessary construction supplies to complete building the house. This will enable Sanaa and her family to live soon in suitable home conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional necessary construction supplies to complete building the house

loans.name: Carito

texts.en: Carito is a farmer in the village of Baringin Sur. He is 56 years old and is married with three children. His wife's name is Fe, she helps him to manage their one hectare family rice field. They work hard to provide their children's needs. Right now, Carito is asking for a loan in the amount of 35,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings to sustain his rice field. Carito hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings to sustain his rice field

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is a married man from the town of Cauayan City in the province of Isabela. He and his wife have both been farmers for 20 years. They primarily grow rice to sell. Fernando does his best to improve their business and take care of their three school-age children. At this time, Fernando is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. He hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. He also hopes to help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Janice Marifel

texts.en:
Janice Marifel lives with her spouse and one child at their simple house in Ugac. To make a living, the couple both manage an internet cafe and acquire good income from it. They have been in the business for over a year now. They usually earn about 20,000 PHP each month. Income goes for meals, bills at home and the rental fee for the stall. They started with 5 units of computers and now they already have 10 units. 

Janice Marifel still wants to improve her services so she is asking for an additional capital of 30,000 PHP to buy ink, colored papers and flash drives used in the internet cafe. She hopes to keep extending friendly services and boost her profits. This way, she will achieve a prosperous life she has been aiming for her family.

loans.use: to buy ink, colored papers and flash drives use in the internet cafe

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Mostafa, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Samah is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to Mostafa, and she is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a salary, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Samah wants to improve the condition of the living room in her house, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new living room seats and improving the house's furniture. This will enable Samah to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new living room seats

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 43 years old. She is married with three children. She and her family live happily in a village and have a plan to raise their standard of living. Farming is one of their major sources of income; they plant and harvest rice to sell. She has been in this business for more than 15 years and usually earns a profit of PHP 30,000 in each harvest season. At this time, Remedios is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for the labor needed for rice planting. She and her family believe that this loan will be an enormous help to their hope of increasing their yield.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for the labor needed for rice planting

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en: Sam Ol is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with one child and her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making creel to sell for more than 10 years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sam Ol is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor's degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Kim Yeang

texts.en: Kim Yeang is 45 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than three years, and has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals. She earns approximately $10 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family's finances, Kim Yeang is requesting a loan of $1500 to pay for her cassava cultivation. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for her cassav cultivation.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des chaussures pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock
Adjo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait agrandir son étalage. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 30-year-old woman. She is single. She has been working as reseller since 2007. She sells shoes for all clients at the market. She buys her products in Lomé and works alone. At this time her main difficulty is stock shortage.

Adjo has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to purchase shoes. She wants to reinvest in her activity.
In the next few years, Adjo would like to expand her display. She says that with her profit she plans on taking care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer, 53 years of age, is married to Rebecca. He has been a farmer for almost 20 years. He grows rice. His net income from his last crop was 25,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his farm. Elmer would like to maintain his relationship with Kiva and ASKI to request larger loans so that he can grow his agricultural business and supplement his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June is a father who has three school-age children. He aims to become financially stable to support his family and give them a better life. He is a farmer who owns and manages a 1.5-hectare rice field in his community. He has been a farmer for almost 10 years and usually earns an income of PHP 19,500 each harvest season. He uses his income for the family's daily expenses and to provide allowances to his children. 

Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, June aims to increase his rice production in order to earn a sufficient income to cover his family's needs. To improve his farming business, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for expenses incurred in transplanting rice. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for expenses incurred in transplanting rice

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 28 years old, married to Charles and they have one infant-age child. To make a living, they both are involved in raising crops particularly planting and harvesting corn to sell. From this, the couple usually gain about PHP 10,000. The income is just enough for family's sustenance for meals and bills at home. Cheryl would like to keep improving their crop production so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy corn seeds and fertilizers for maintenance of the farming business. 

Cheryl would like to achieve plentiful yields every harvest season to become successful someday.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers for maintenance of the farming business

loans.name: Ra'eda

texts.en:
Ra'eda is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured next to the family's tractor.

Ra'eda is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a salary. For the past three years, Ra'eda has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project. However, she needs more support to cover her costs.

Ra'eda is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and to make some repairs to the tractor. She hopes this will increase her sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and repair her tractor

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, married and has three children. Vilma and her spouse manage a cornfield which they cultivate, plant and harvest. They have been in the business for almost 10 years. Vilma is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for land cultivation, buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This way, they will be able to improve crop production. 

In the future, Vilma hopes to achieve abundant harvests to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation, buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.en:
Corn farming is the business of Napoleon. He had been doing it for 10 years now. His wife, Leonarda, helps him manage the business. They have eight children all of whom have settled into marriage.

Now, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 for additional capital in maintenance of the farming business. He will buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. 

Napoleon hopes to keep attaining good profits from the business for the  family's economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa is 24 years old. She is the mother of one child and resides with her husband and her parents in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a sculptor who earns about $4 per day. Due to difficulty in her family’s transportation, Channa is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build her own house to live separately from her parents.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie aims to improve her rice farming business in order to earn satisfy her family's needs and support her children's education. She is 48 years old and has two school-age children. She is separated from her husband due to problems and unavoidable circumstances. In spite of this, she has the confidence and determination to improve their standard of living and give her children a better life.

Marjorie has owned and managed a rice farming business for almost 20 years.
