She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for expenses incurred in transplanting rice. Despite the hardships and calamities she has encountered in life, she is determined to maintain her farming business and hopes that she will also improve the family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for expenses incurred in transplanting rice

loans.name: Mearn

texts.en: Mearn is 30 years old. She is a mother of one child and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of purchasing rice to resale for more than two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $7 per day. In order to improve her family’s living condition, Mearn is requesting a loan of $1000 to raise capital for her business to purchase more rice to resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new concrete house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more rice to resale

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila, 39 years of age, is married and blessed with seven children. She has a rice farm, which she has owned for almost 20 years. From the last crop, her net income was 30,000 PHP. She's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds for her rice farm. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to Laila, who sees the loans as her only opportunity to develop her agricultural business and improve her financial security.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds for her rice farm

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 25 year old young woman. She is married and a mother to two sons, her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.
For the past one year, Haneen has been running a store selling clothes, which has been a profitable project, but she also needs more support to cover the costs.

Haneen is requesting a 1,200 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new collection of summer clothes. This will provide to Haneen a wide collection of summer clothes, so that she can compete with others well and satisfy her customers. This will increase sales and improve the family's income and ensure better living conditions to the family.
Haneen is photographed in her store.

loans.use: To purchase new collection of Summer clothes

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: With his desire to improve his family's living situation, Alexander has devoted himself full-time to his rice farm for ten years. He is 48 years old and is married to Thelma. They have five children. Alexander works hard to give their children a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty. He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm. He hopes to grow and increase his yield with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 24-year-old single man. His father is a trader who earns an income, but he needs more support to cover his costs and meet the family's needs.

Thaer wants to open a grocery store, so he is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him buy more construction supplies. Taking this loan will help him to complete the store's construction and will enable Thaer to open his own grocery store soon. This will improve Thaer's income and help him to become more self-sufficient.

Thaer is photographed at the site of his store.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for building his store

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 35-year-old man. He is married and the father of one son and two daughters. He is a worker, but his salary is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Saleem wants to pay for some repairs to his house, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of installing tiles and painting the house. This will improve the family's living conditions.

Saleem is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To make some repairs to his house

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 28-year-old mother of 3 children. She works hard at her business in order to earn a higher income. She is patiently selling snacks in her village every day.  She believes her business does well because she is very nice to her clients.

Divina is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw materials for cooking snacks such as pancakes. Hopefully she will earn a higher income in order to save for the children's education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her food business

loans.name: Kabirou

texts.fr:
Kabirou est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Kabirou travaille comme boucher depuis 2003. Il vend de la viande pour tous clients au marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas satisfaire toutes les demandes de ses clients.
Kabirou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la viande. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kabirou voudrait devenir grossiste. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Kabirou is a 36-year old man. He is single without children. Kabirou has been working as a butcher since 2003. He sells meat to the general public at the market. He stocks up in Lomé. He works by himself. At present, his main challenge is meeting customer demand. 
Kabirou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy meat. He would like to invest in his business. In the years to come, Kabirou would like to become a wholesaler. He says that he  expects being able to provide for himself thanks to his revenues.

loans.use: to buy beef and lamb meat.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is thirty-four years old, single, and lives with five family members.

Alaa has owned a food market since 2007. He sells soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish and dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Aliyétou

texts.fr:
Aliyétou est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de voiture. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 17 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.
Aliyétou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Aliyétou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Aliyétou voudrait acheter en plus grande quantité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aliyétou is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to a car salesman. She has two children who attend school. The elder is 17 years old and the younger is 15 years old.

Aliyétou has been working as a retailer since 2010. She sells cereals from her home to a wide variety of customers. She purchases her goods in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her greatest difficulty is stock shortages.

Aliyétou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Aliyétou would like to purchase greater quantities [of stock]. She says that, with her profits, she plans to see to the academic expenses of her children.

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 64 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle n’a pas d’enfants.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des pagnes pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Afi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 64-year-old woman. She is married to a retired man. She does not have children. She has been a reseller since 2005. She sells “pagnes” [colorful wrap-around fabric] from home for all customers.  She buys her products in Lomé and works alone. At this time, her main difficulty is stock shortage.

Afi has requested a second loan from WAGES to purchase “pagnes”. She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the next few years, Afi would like to expand the size of her activity. She says that with her profit she plans on taking care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes.

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants, les quatre femmes du groupe Lafia habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente des tissus, de la pomme de terre, de chaussures et du gingembre. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou 1ere de la droite vers la gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 rouleaux de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Sikasso, auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes, en ambulant, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Korotoumou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
Married in their majority in traditional families, the four women of group Lafia are on average forty years old with five children. They all live in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other through bonds of kin, neighborly relations, and professional activities.
They retail fabrics, potatoes, shoes and ginger.
In order to increase their working capital, the group members are joining Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth solidarity loan.
Mrs. Korotoumou, first from the right to the left, is planning on using her loan to purchase two rolls of fabric. She gets her supplies locally in Sikasso from wholesalers and retails door-to-door, from home and at the market, to a clientele comprising men and women.
With this loan, Mrs. Korotoumou is planning on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA to be used by reinvesting in the business and supporting her family alimentary needs.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Assoukowe

texts.fr:
Assoukowe est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. 
Assoukowe travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1987. Elle vend des poissons fumés et frits pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Assoukowe a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Assoukowe voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Assoukowe is a 45-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer.

Assoukowe has been working as a retailer since 1987. She sells fried and smoked fish from her home to a wide variety of customers. She purchases her goods in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her greatest difficulty is not being able to accommodate all of her clients.

Assoukowe has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase fish. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Assoukowe would like to increase the size of her business. She says that, with the profits, she plans to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en: Gaspar is a farmer who owns and manages a rice farming business in his community. He is 32 years old and has three children. Two of them are now in elementary education. He aims to improve his farming business to earn a higher income to satisfy his family's necessities and support the schooling of his children. He plans to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production. He is asking for an additional capital of P20,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and expenses incurred in planting rice. He believes that his patience and hard work will enable him to work out his plan and he is hoping that he will be having a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for expenses incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Ern

texts.en: Ern is 51 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $10 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ern is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Maly

texts.en: Maly is 43 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Maly is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase more groceries to resale. This money will help her expand her groceries store and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her store to make it bigger and stronger for storage.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Wazarietou

texts.fr:
Wazarietou est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 18 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.
Wazarietou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des chaussures pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Wazarietou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures, des sous-vêtements et des éponges. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Wazarietou voudrait ouvrir sa propre boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Wazarietou is a 40-year old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children, both of whom are in school. The eldest child is 18 years old, and the youngest is 15. Since 200, Wazarietou has been working as a vendor. She sells shoes to the general public at the local market. She stocks up at Lomé. She works by herself. At present, her main concern is running out of stock.

Wazarietou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy shoes, underwear and sponges. She would like to reinvest in her business.
In the years to come, Wazarietou would like to open her own store. She says that she expects to provide for her children’s needs thanks to her revenues.

loans.use: to buy shoes and underwear [for resale].

loans.name: Marzan

texts.en: Marzan is 30 years old, married and has three children. He owns and manages a rice farming business in his community. He plans to expand his rice plantation to earn sufficient income to cover his family's needs. Despite problems and difficulties that he has encountered in life, he has the determination to uplift his family's status of living to give his family a better life. To work out his plan, he is asking for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice. He believes that the loan will help him to improve his business as he continue to work hard and strive harder. He hopes that someday, he will improve his family's status of living and becomes financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for the labor cost incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador is a father who owns and manages a rice farming business in his community. This is the main source of his family's living. He aims to improve his farming business and to earn a sufficient income to satisfy his family's needs and finance the education of his three children. He wants his children to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. Due to financial difficulties, Dominador wants to ask for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice. He mentioned that the loan will help him improve his rice farming business and he is hoping that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Yeik

texts.en: Yeik is 37 years old. She is a mother of three children and she resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about $3 per day. One of her children is employed in the factory and earns about $2 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Yeik is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries for resale. By doing so, she will earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23 year old single young man. Ahmad has been raising and selling sheep and cows and its products, which has been a profitable project, but he also needs more support to cover the costs.

Ahmad is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep. This will expand his project and increase sales and improve Ahmad's income and ensure him a better future.

Ahmad is photographed in his farm.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
Amevi est une femme âgée de 53 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.
Amevi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend du maïs, des tubercules d’igname et de l’huile pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule.  Au moment, sa difficulté principale la rupture de stock.
Amevi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs ; des tubercules d’igname et de l’huile. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Amevi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille.
texts.en:
Amevi is a 53-year-old woman who is a widow. She has two children, of whom one is in school. The first child is 20 years old, and the last is 12. Amevi has been working as a retailer since 2000. She sells corn, yam tubers, and oil to all comers to her home. She purchases her goods in Lomé. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is an inventory shortage.

Amevi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy corn, yam tubers, and oil. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the next few years, Amevi would like to expand her business. With the profits, she says she plans on ensuring a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to buy yams, oil, and more

loans.name: Novelio

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulties, Novelio did not pursue his studies in secondary education. He is now 23 years old and still single. He helps his parent in managing their rice farming business to earn income and support the education of his younger brother and sister. He aims to become financially stable so that he will be able to support his family when he goes to settle down. 

To improve his farming business, he is asking for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice. He believes that through this loan, he can improve his farming business and he is hoping that he will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Souklema

texts.fr:
Souklema est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un policier. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Souklema travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des produits de beauté pour tous clients dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Souklema a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Souklema voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Souklema is a 31-year-old woman, married to a policeman. She has two children attending school: the elder is 10 years old and the younger is 8.

Souklema has been working as a retail merchant since 2010. She sells beauty products to allcomers in the city. She buys her products in Lome and works alone. At this time, her main problem is being out of stock.

Souklema requested her second Wages loan to buy cosmetics. She wants to reinvest in the business. In coming years, Souklema would like to open a shop. She said that with the profits, she expects to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr:
Adidjatou est une femme âgé(e) de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un  tailleur. Elle a 03 enfants, tous scolarisés. Le premier a 21 ans et le dernier a 14 ans.  
Adidjatou travaille comme restauratrice et revendeuse de détergent  depuis 2000. Ces enfants l’aident dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle le fait à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Adidjatou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des denrées alimentaires (riz, spaghetti, huile végétale) depuis 2000. Elle veut investir dans l’activité en ouvrant une boutique. Elle veut assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Adidjatou is a 44 year-old woman. She is married to a tailor. She has three children, who all got to school. The eldest is 21 and the youngest is 14 years old. 
Adidjatou has been working as a food seller and as a detergent retailer since 2000. Her children assist her in running her business. She does it from home, and gets her supplies from Lome.
Adidjatou requested her third loan from WAGES to purchase food products (rice, spaghetti, vegetable oil). She wants to invest in her business by opening a store. She wants to insure that her family is fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy food products and detergents.

loans.name: Abdel Sattar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has one child.

Abdel Sattar has owned a shop since 1995, selling construction materials. He has more than fifteen years experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a $2400 loan in order to renovate his shop’s walls and floors and to add more shelves. He is aiming to earn more profits and the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop’s walls and floors and to add more shelves.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Restauratrice et revendeuse de bijoux depuis 2005 à domicile et dans un marché de la place, Alimatou est maman de 03 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. L’ainé a 22ans et le dernier 13ans. Son conjoint est administrateur. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des denrées alimentaires pour la restauration et des bijoux.  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, assurer sa prospérité. Elle veut assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
A food vendor and jewelry retailer since 2005, working from home and at one of the local markets, Alimatou is the mother of three children who all attend school. The eldest is 22 years old and the youngest 13. Her husband is an administrator.
She is requesting this first loan from WAGES to purchase food products for her restaurant activity, and jewelry. She wants to reinvest in her business and guarantee it prospers. She wants to insure that everyone in her family does well.

loans.use: to purchase food products and jewelry.

loans.name: Mouayed

texts.en:
Mouayed is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has one child. He lives with four family members, one of whom works.

Mouayed has owned a stationery store since 2005. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a $2,000 loan in order to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is 24 years old, married, and had one child. To make a living, Bienvenido raises crops, particularly planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been in this business for almost three years and earns about P8,000 each harvest season, twice in a year. He would like to improve his crop output so he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. 

Bienvenido would like to keep producing good harvests from the business to pay for his child's education to earn a degree and good employment for the betterment of their lives someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Faress

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has four children. Faress has owned a shop since 2008, selling accessories, cosmetics and perfumes. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas. He applied for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a split air conditioner, to install more shelves, and to purchase additional goods. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase a split air conditioner, to install more shelves and to purchase additional goods.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin works hard in order to earn a living. He is 55 years of age, married, and has been blessed with two children. His older child has been settled for marriage while his younger one is still single.

According to him, his heart is full of excitement and willingness in cultivating his three hectares of rice. The income generated from his farming business was used for his children's education. He is really thankful to all KIVA lenders for providing him with financial resources. Since he repaid his previous loans, this time, he is asking for a larger amount of P50,000 allowing him to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.  He believes that these funds would give him hopes in fulfilling his dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Muslim

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. His name is Muslim, and he is a young client (27 years old) who is married and has one child. Muslim is a blacksmith; in 2003 he opened his workshop where he makes doors and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.Muslim applied for $2400 youth loan in order to purchase a blacksmithing machine and an electrical generator. He aims to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a blacksmithing machine and an electrical generator.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgé(e) de 24ans. Elle est mariée  å un  chauffeur.  Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 06 ans et le dernier a 02 ans.  
Abla travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes et habits depuis 2006. Elle exerce l'activité à domicile à ses clients et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Abla a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des habits et des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Abla is a 24-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children, including one in school. The eldest is six years old and the youngest is two.

Abla has been working as a retailer of fabrics and garments since 2006. She carries on her business at her customer's homes and resupplies in Lomé.

Abla has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy clothes and pagnes (colorful West-African fabric). She wants to reinvest in the business and ensure her family's development.

loans.use: Buy pagnes and garments

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en: Dafrosa is in her early 40s and is married with four children who go to school. She has had a shop selling food stuffs and cold drinks since 2005. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be her 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to repair her shop by putting in more shelves and floor tiles, to buy land, and for household expenses; she has paid back all her loans successfully.  Dafrosa wants a loan to open a clothing shop. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. She will share this loan with her loan group "Karoti," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a clothes shop.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.fr:
Vivian est une femme âgé(e) de 57 ans. Elle est mariée å un  retraité.  Elle a 03enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 31ans et le dernier 27ans.
Vivian travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2010. Elle exerce seule l’activité à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des produits congelés.
Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Vivian is an 57-year-old woman. She is married to a retiree and has three children, all in school. The eldest is 31 and the youngest is 27 years old.

Vivian has been working as a retailer of general food products since 2010. She runs the business by herself from her home and resupplies in Lome.

She requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase general food products and frozen goods. She wants to reinvest in the business and ensure her family's development.

loans.use: Buy general food products and frozen goods.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Amjad has owned a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent, to renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent, to renovate his market, and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: This borrower, Ali, is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has four children. Ali is a florist; in 2005 he opened his own shop, making flower arrangements in vases, bowls, baskets or other containers and bouquets. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas. Ali applied for a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He aims to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 47 years old, married and has three children.

Leila has been a tailor since 2009; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for women and kids. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting an $1800 loan to purchase two tailoring machines and a generator. She is aiming to earn more profits and the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase two tailoring machines and a generator.

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en: Joseph is in his early 30s and is married with two children. He has been running a butcher business for four years now.  He works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his meat stock and for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully. Joseph wants a loan to buy more meat to resell. His dream is to one day be able to buy land. He will share this loan with his loan group "Maarifa" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more meat to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 17 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a small pub and a retail store where she sells items such as maize flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a town and her primary customers are people who come to visit the town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize for selling. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop in the nearby town within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children from the profits that will be generated.

loans.use: to buy maize for her retail store.

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa lives in a simple house at Baculud along with her husband and child. She and her husband cultivate rice on a hectare plot of land that they sell to traders in their village. Ma Luisa usually earns about 15,000 PHP during each harvest season, twice in a year. Her income provides for their meals, allowances, and provides revolving capital. 

Ma. Luisa would like to ensure a good crop and is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide to improve her yield in the coming harvest seasons. In the future, she hopes to keep making her crops productive and achieve a prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Srey Pov is 41 years old. She is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Srey Pov is a homemaker and her husband is a construction worker who also runs a motor taxi service and earns approximately 13 USD daily. Her children are employed and earn about 5 USD each day. 

Srey Pov is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to pay for her child’s wedding ceremony. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a widow who lives in Don Domingo with her one child. She carries the burden alone to provide for her child's school fees. Angelina works selling clothing and accessories from her stall at the public market and earns about 10,000 PHP each month.

Angelina is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more clothing, caps, and belts to sell. In the future, she wants to earns a consistent profit from her business to achieve a stable business that will ensure a good future for her child.

loans.use: to buy clothing, caps, and belts to sell
